name: Wildcat Willie
review_text: A great coffee making machine. This is the latest Keurig we have bought and enjoyed. My wife is a coffee devotee and she deserves really good coffee and so I have made sure that we always have a working Keurig with good K-cups. All the machines we have owned make great coffee and all of them have little nitpicky problems. We don't remove our water reservoir to fill it, but get water from the refrigerator dispenser so it is filtered. Doing that means we to have to pour in water through the lid and this new machine makes that very easy because it is hinged and stays open by itself. This means I no longer have to remove the entire lid. The reservoir is also much larger so it lasts a lot longer between fillings. The display is large and gives clear information about the brewing process and is very easy to modify to your own brewing style and tastes. Very nice functionality of the electronics and settings. The brew process starts very quickly once a selection is made and dispenses quickly and well. The unit we bought has functioned almost flawlessly for about two months now and we are very pleased. Now for the nitpicking... The needle can clog a little more easily than our old unit; while making non-ground coffee drinks like the Caf  Escapes powder drinks it not-infrequently stops up and requires a little attention. Even so, the new interface makes this easier to address too; it notifies you that you have to raise the lever and remove the k-cup instead of just stopping dispensing. The grate that the cups sit on is both handy and problematic. Handy in that it is easily removed and therefore allows you to use taller cups, problematic in that it doesn't stay snapped in place firmly and so I am always pushing it back in place. The biggest quibble for me were the instructions that came with it for one simple reason and that is it said to run one cup of clear water through before starting to brew your coffee. I say forget that and run a whole reservoir though it first. I ran a couple of cups first and it still tasted slightly metallic and chemical so I dumped it out and ran a bunch more water through before brewing my coffee. The bottom line for me is that coffee costs a ton more than it did a few years ago, but coffee in our kitchen is a pleasure to drink and very consistent in brew characteristics.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I bought this to replace my Keurig B75 Platinum (which lasted about 4 years before the pump started to die). It has the following differences:
review_title: 3) I bought the carafe as well and it is nice to brew 5 cups at once when guests are ...

review_text: It's pretty. Love the large screen and capacity on the reservoir. Takes about a minute to fill 12 oz cup with hot water from button press. However, I cannot stand the noises it makes. First thing in the morning I do not want to hear SQUEEEEEEEEL as I pick up my cup. In person, it's like nails on a chalkboard. Not sure if it's defective or designed that way to keep small children away from it. Skip to the last 10 seconds of the video to hear it.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Edward
review_text: Amit's burned down my kitchen.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Sunny Side Up
review_text: This was my stepping stone from the Keurig 55 which i owned for one week and liked it so much I then upgraded to this machine 575. The convenience of this machine, and the many different flavored coffee pods that are available is awesome.
review_title: I'm in love!! UPDATED: please read and respond if having same issue
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Sierra Elise
review_text: I love this machine. I was concerned with some of the reviews, but so far it has been perfect for us. It holds so much water, so we don't have to refill it as often. The temperature options are great, and you can set the water to be cooler for immediate drinking ability. the best part? YOU CAN FINALLY HAVE A SET WAKEUP TIME FOR IT! No more waiting for it to turn on and warm up in the morning. Coffee first thing is so amazing. Just press and go! The night light settings and water lights are a nice added touch as well. There are more size options and you can select for a bolder coffee flavor or an option for drinks other than coffee. Each of these settings have worked perfectly and we've noticed a difference in the flavors whenever we tweak settings. I could not be happier with this purchase!
review_title: We love it! 10/10. *bold coffee is the best!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Fangyu Luo
review_text: My eyes sparked at the moment I received this Kuerig coffee maker. It looks fancy, has those functions of changing light color and background color of control panel, has a water filter... which are pretty cool! But, after less than a week use, it broke. As shown in my photo, it asked me to clean the needle. I did needle maintenance following the instructions with that little valve comes with the machine, I disassembled the needle part and clean each of them, make sure water is between the min and max line. Still didn't work. This problem happened twice in a week use. I just wanted a cup of coffee but it wasted me 5 k-cups and 1 hour in the second broke. Sorry it doesn't work for  me. Returned.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: This Keurig is awful! I'm not sure if maybe I just got a faulty one but for some reason the water comes out really fast and breaks open the kcup which then get coffee grounds everywhere! I am constantly taking it apart to clean it which is not a good use of my time since this is at my work.
review_title: I am constantly taking it apart to clean it which is not a good use of my time since this is at my ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: We are very disappointed with this particular machine. We've had it a year and would not buy it again when it dies. We bought our first Keurig several years ago and wore it out and then wore out a second one. We bought this one to replace that second one and have never liked it as much. It takes longer to brew a cup of coffee. It's noisier. It requires considerable more maintenance. Coffee pod explosions in the machine are a frequent occurrence. See photos. Would I recommend this machine? Not on a bet. I am disabled and I love the convenience of an individual cup of coffee without having to fight a large carafe but I will certainly find something else to replace this machine when it no longer works at all.
review_title: We are very disappointed with this particular machine
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Maria Lynn
review_text: Make sure you read the directions and you will have a perfect cup of coffee every time. Members of our household all leave at different times in the morning so it is great to have a fresh cup, instead of stale leftovers from the earliest riser. I had to measure how much liquid my different mugs held so I would know what size to choose. We bought the refillable pods (a set of 5) and they do a great job and save me quite a bit of money. And this way we can each have a cup of our own favorite coffee. It comes with extra filters and an easy to understand manual. We got the carafe for when we need a potful quickly. It makes coffee as fast as our Bunn coffeemaker, which is very fast indeed. Beware of overfilling a reusable pod, you'll get some spillage when making a cup. The touch screen is very intuitive and easy to operate. I like that it has an eco-mode where it goes off while not being used; and you can set the amount of time it stays on when you use it. It still heats up rapidly when "waking up". The whole lid of the water holder comes off or you can raise a little lid on it. The lid opening is big enough so that you don't spill when filling it. I am very happy with my K575 model. I did a lot of research before choosing which model to buy and this is definitely the most versatile model.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ryan V.
review_text: This was our second Keurig in three days. Unfortunately, both of them smelled strongly of plastic. I washed everything and used vinegar to help get rid of the smell, but even after running an entire tank of of water through (12 oz at a time), the plastic smell and taste just getting stronger. It was like the hot water just brought it out even more. It was very alarming, and made me concerned that there were chemicals leeching into the water. Also, the lever to open and close the machine kept catching and would get stuck, so it wouldn't open. Additionally, while closing the lever with no pod in it, it would often display the brewing display instead of the hot water dispensing display. There seemed to be a glitch. Lastly, while brewing the cocoa pods, it made a very loud and alarming whirring sound. I think we will switch to a safer and more environmentally friendly method like the Chemex.
review_title: It was like the hot water just brought it out even more
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Stuna
review_text: So BOTH my kcup 2.0 machines died, one was the home unit, one was a travel unit, so bought this figuring that this latest model would be a step up from previous models. Good news, it wakes up, does what it needs to, make a great hot cup of coffee. No need to put water thru it to get oils and crap out, it just worked and taste great (so far, only done like 20-30 cups thru it so far....) Bad news, it takes longer than any previous units I've had to brew a single cup. Between cups, much longer. I have not used a timer, but I'd say this thing takes like 25-50% more time to brew a cup... I can live with that, but I often do a second cup right then (I have big coffee mugs) and this thing take like 2 minutes to cycle to get ready for cup 2. And better yet, you load the second kcup in, it doesn't recognize it when water is ready, so you have to cycle the kcup holder for it to brew - my last one would recognize that a new cup had been placed in there and would start blinking the "start" button *and that one took like 15-30 seconds to get ready for cup 2). I would give my old unit 4.5 stars, but it died. If you've used an older 2.0 and go this this and expect quick multiple cups, you may be inclined to rate this at a 2 star due to delays (the idea here is to be fast, right? This doesn't quite have what older units had...)
review_title: Meh, older units were better, this new one is sloooower
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Dave
review_text: UPDATED AGAIN! Well, the Keurig quit working with distilled water if using the carafe - it works fine with single pods. I changed my rating to 1 star simply because Keurig seems to be utilizing technology to make sure you buy their products ONLY and you have to use other than distilled water. Why? Apparently so they can force you to buy more of their products. Since you cannot use distilled water, the device will need descaling. One of the main reasons for me to use the more expensive is reduced maintenance with good coffee. The Keurig  brews good coffee but a lot of other makers to do. When this thing dies someday I won't buy another. IMO: A GREEDY COMPANY.
review_title: Watch out if using distilled water!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Dorothy Kay Rogers
review_text: I just received this coffee maker a couple of weeks ago. It makes coffee that has a strong chemical taste. It is not drinkable and seems to be getting worse. I have owned several Keurig coffeemakers over the years and have never seen anything like this! I have run multiple cups of coffee and hot water through it and it's getting worse.  Don't buy this machine! I want my money back!!
review_title: Makes coffee with strong chemical taste!! Don't buy!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ElaineJ
review_text: I chose this model because I wanted a Kuerig that would do it all: make single cups, carafes with both pods and my own coffee, and make hot water.  It does a good job of making singles like the cheaper models.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Annapolis76EB
review_text: Really a poor quality machine. I own a Keurig Vue and now this K575. The K575 is a total disaster and should be recalled by Keurig for such poor quality. The needles constantly jam and result in a mess of coffee grinds all over the machine and in your coffee, or the machine simply will not work until you clean it. This isn't a once in a while issue, this is every 2 - 3 cups. I don't think I am an isolated case as friends with this machine have had the exact same experience. The Vue is a far superior machine that never once jammed or left grinds in my coffee, but with the availability of Vue pods being slim to none, I purchased the K575 and regret the decision immensely! I am now using my Vue again and feel I wasted $150 on a coffee machine I can't even use. I am in the process of searching for other single serve machines and hope to find a brand that can actually brew a cup of coffee without making a mess all over the machine and in my coffee mug. I strongly recommend you stay away from this machine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Mountain111Man
review_text: I have had this Keurig for about a week, at first there was a very strong plastic taste. I looked up some recommendations on how to get rid of it. I filled it almost all the way up with water and 1/2 cup of vinager. Ran that all the way through until it needed more water, dumped remander, rinsed with water, then filled it all the way back up with water and ran that completely through! No plastic taste left! It worked great! We love our new Keurig and have had get-togethers just based around our new coffee pot. Love it!
review_title: It worked great! We love our new Keurig and have had ...

Again, save yourself the trouble and get the old school kind with the three cup size buttons on the top.  There are less components to short out and it's easier to fix if it gets clogged or stops working.

review_text: Context: I leave the Keurig lid up to keep it dry in the k-cup holder.  I set my Keurig to automatically turn on in the morning.
review_title: Poor design but at least it brews

name: Mike
review_text: This is my 3rd Keurig (but first in the 2.0 line) since My first one I found about 10 years ago and I'm sorry to say that I think they're getting worse every year. It's really slow and takes about 2x as long as the older models. If I don't have it in the strong brew mode it does brew quicker but then it's just not as good of a cup. No big deal as long as I don't have 3 guests waiting for coffee. One more thing to mention is if it's in the strong brew mode it gets stuck at times and the screen tells ya to call a 1-800 number. I use the cleaner ball thing that comes with the machine and get it to work again after a few attempts but it's annoying. So I think even tho this is the best one on the market , or supposed to be, I can't seeing this one lasting a year at 7-10 cups per week. As a note I only use bottle water water in mine. Clean filtered water makes the best coffee. I hate to do a negative review cuz I do love this compared to brewing a pot of coffee the way we all did 10 years ago but I wish it was a better product.
review_title: Screen says call 1-800# when it gets stuck n don't brew
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Penny Bartlett
review_text: I bought one of these for my office and loved it so much I replaced the keurig that I had at home also.  I love it.  However there was a plastic taste to the coffee when I first used it.  I read a review from awhile ago and it said to use 1/2 cup vinegar and add it to the water and run it all the way through.  When empty rinse the reservoir and fill again and run it all the way through empty again.  After I did that there was no plastic taste or chemical aftertaste.  You might want to consider doing this before you make your first cup of beverage.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Melanie S.
review_text: I purchased this machine last November to have as a backup in case my older model died. I opened it and set it up today (August). I ran one 12-oz cup of WATER through it, and it stopped working. The customer service person was nice enough but told me I would need to purchase bottled water for this model. Nowhere in the promotional information was the requirement for bottled water mentioned. Only on page 14 of the manual, which one cannot see until the machine is purchased and unpacked, does one find out about having to BUY water to make coffee. I am furious. It is too late to return this machine to Amazon. If IF I purchase a single-serve coffee maker again, I don't think it will be Keurig and I will definitely purchase it locally, not on Amazon, so that I can return it. I wish I had read the reviews. This is apparently a faulty model that is STILL being sold. If someone has a recommendation about another Keruig model that is less persnickety, please let me know. I have wasted two hours with this one today.
review_title: This model is faulty and information is misleading
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Curt
review_text: My feelings about this unit in particular and the Keurig 2.0 concept in general is mixed. I purchased this for my wife, the main coffee drinker in the house, but it fell short of both of our expectations.
review_title: The 2.0 DRM model is frustrating and expensive considering the mediocre output.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Mike
review_text: I bought this because i loved my other Keurig 2.0 474 model.  I couldnt believe the reviews but the ones that warned of a melted plastic smell and taste are 100% true.  I followed all directions for first use. There must be a platic part in the new models that is melting within the device. I dont think it is the water basin which is what the manufacturer will replace if you complain.  It seems to be a part that cant be replaced inside the coffee maker.  They really should have recalled these instead of sell them out.  I had the worst platic after taste in my mouth and it took a day to get rid of it.  I wonder what the health issues could be from this product defect.  I am upset such a revolutionary product and conpany could make and sell such a defective upgrade and not recall them from the market.  Dont buy this model.  The older work fine. Not sure when we will be able to trust the new models of Keurig again but im not going to keep ordering until i get one without the melting plastic issue.
review_title: Product Defect - melted plastic smell and taste
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Rick F
review_text: Marketed that it makes travel mug and carafe brews, but first thing you see when you unbox is a sheet of paper that states. Keurig has discontinued k-mug and k-carafe pods. So why the heck are they still making and selling the machine?
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Scott M Gorham
review_text: Will never buy another Keurig again. Bought this to replace another coffee maker and what a mistake. After 2 weeks I started getting the water under pressure, perform needle maintenance. So I did this and it didn't fix it. Just kept wasting k-cups as this machine kept destroying them. So I called Keurig and they agreed to send me out another unit. Now 3 months later the same thing is happening again. It doesn't matter if I use Dunkin k-cups or a store brand. I am going to call them once more but considering all the issues I see I don't think I will continue to use it.
review_title: Water under pressure - so is my patience.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: The Keurig Thunderjava 5000 is a remarkable machine. Here's what you want to know up front:
review_title: If you're looking at this machine seriously, just go ahead and buy it
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I have purchased 5 Keurig Single Serve machines.  I have enjoyed using the 4 units.  Each has allowed usage of different brands of coffee besides the Keurig.  The 5th machine, as seen in the picture, does not allow usage of other pod brands. Twice I have purchased other brands of coffee.  I started to make my coffee and a warning on the Keurig panel stated  the brand was not compatible.  I took the pods home and was able to use them on another Keurig.  I invested more money in the machine and it does not perform as well as my other 4.  It is too late to return it.
review_title: This coffee pot is expensive and lacks the performance of other Keurig's!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Lester
review_text: Very disappointed, All pictures show unit with cup and carafe.
review_title: Does not come with items in picture
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Raiza Arnone
review_text: I have been on a quest for a good coffee maker, and based on reviews was hesitant to purchase another Keurig but went ahead any way-- this was my third purchase. The coffee doesn't taste bad, and there are many nice features on this device, including ability to make a small pot of coffee. I guess good and bad, as it over complicates the simple act of making coffee. My biggest complaints: water temperature...if you don't guzzle your coffee, after 5 minutes you will have luke warm coffee. Yuck!!! Ive read that this is due to American safety regulations which don't allow temperatures above 132. Ridiculous!! If I had read that before purchase, that would've been a deal breaker for me.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I just purchased this item a few weeks ago to replace our old Keurig which died.  I MISS THAT OLD ONE!  I read people's concerns about the lower brewing temperature; however, a Keurig rep replied to a product question less than a year ago about the temperature, and she stated the highest temp was 192F-197F (depending on the k-cup product used).  Based on the representation of a company rep, I purchased this new unit.  I'm sorry to say, but the highest temperature is NOT 192F for k-cups.  My old Keurig which I had to replace did go that hot - I miss it, as this one is nowhere near as good.  This one's highest temperature is a measly 166F, which we got to 170F after setting it to the "high altitude" feature.  This machine takes twice as long to brew a cup as my old Keurig, and the coffee is not as good, as it's brewed at a way lower temperature.  I'm so disappointed in the unit.  I could care less about the changeable graphics & pretty color options on the screen, or that the reservoir has four different light color choices, because I want it for one thing: to brew delicious coffee, and it just doesn't.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: MA
review_text: If you've been making coffee using a drip coffee maker, then you'll love the single-serve Keurig K575.  But if you've used a single-serve coffee maker before, you won't be too impressed with this one.  Here's why:
review_title: Too Much Hype, Not Enough Substance
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Daryl Hoffman
review_text: This is the second Keurig I have purchased in the last 2 months. After 2 weeks the lcd screen kept going blank so I returned it to the merchant. I decided to try the 575 since It is one of the newer models and I figured the bugs should be out of it. I was partly right. The lcd has not gone blank yet, but the main reason I purchased this model is because it has an adjustable temperature setting. I checked the water temperature on high with a certified digital thermometer and am only getting 182 degree water with no pod and directly out of the machine. I sent Keurig an e-mail a week ago asking if anything can be done to increase the temperature and never received a reply. I will give them a couple more days and this one is going to be returned too.
review_title: Way below the ideal temperature for hot coffee.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: C_Webb_
review_text: When you pay this much for something you expect all the parts to be in the box. Naturally, one piece was missing from mine. The water filter install date selector that should be on the top of the filter holder, wasn't anywhere in the box or hiding within the cavities of the machine itself!?! Missing parts is a big no no for me, add in that the "KUERIG 2.0" brew button wasn't put on straight and you get a 1 star review!!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: bonnie
review_text: this is my third Keurig this year.  I returned two and bought this one because it was more expensive.  It stops brewing with a message to clean nozzle.  It spills coffee grounds all over.  I take all the parts out as directed and clean.  Put back in.  Next day it spews out the coffee grounds. I am so disappointed in Keurig.  My first one I had for 5 years with never a problem.  It got so I had to unplug and replug each time I used it so decided to get a new one.  It has been frustrating ever since.  I am looking into another manufacturer.
review_title: Keurig has gone to the dogs.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Healing Hands
review_text: We have had to "rig" our expensive coffee maker whether we use real Keurig or non-keurig pods. The new, expensive makers include an in-fared that wants to ensure you are using the real Keurig pods due to their stocks being down they changed to including the scanner. (We use the lid of a pod that actually works on top of either Keurig of non Keurig pods. Seriously, way below average.
review_title: Even Keurig brand pods DO NOT WORK in this Keurig
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jeff
review_text: Great Coffee Maker - not flawless, but still great.  The maker looks good, is easy do use, has a lot of options, has a good sized water well, and makes a hot cup of coffee.  Been using it for several months, and don't know what I would do without it.  I've read some reviews where they mentioned the coffee was not hot, but I haven't seen that at all.  It's always hot.  Now, if you add a pound of sugar or a quart of creamer (or anything for that matter), it will cool it off of course, but I can only sip it/let it sit after it is done brewing. It's hot, not scalding hot, but hot.  No complaints from me there.  Not to take away from how much I really like this coffee maker, here are a few of the potential cons (for others) that I've seen *just to be objective* - none of these bother me, just stuff I didn't realize when I purchased.  The amount of coffee dispensed (various sizes up to 12oz can be selected for standard k-cup pods) is not consistent - sometimes it  is [a little] less, sometime more - it's close, but noticeably off.  Pre-heating does take a while (couple minutes), so can be a drag when trying to grab a cup and go.  When preheating, you can hear it - it's not loud by my definition, but I can hear it in other rooms - there is no sneaking a cup of coffee around here :-)  It is a larger maker, so you will probably want some counter space for it - didn't have any issues here with our countertop space, but it does have a "presence".  All in all, it's a great coffee maker!
review_title: Great Coffee Maker - Don't know how I survived without it
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: NVCharger
review_text: Works great for K-Cups, but, for K-Carafe pods, not so much. Every time I want to use a k-carafe pod I have to unplug the thing, remove the water reservoir, wash it, remove the pod holder assembly, wash it, re-assemble the entire thing, plug it back in and hope for the best. If I skip any of these steps it tells me "Add more water please" and I have to start all over. And at best it is a 50-50 chance it will work. So, after I use up the expensive k-carafe pods I ordered, it is back to nothing but the k-cups and I guess I can use the carafe as a flower pot. What a waste of money just to be able to do the same thing my old one did. Some times simpler is better with out all of the cute little messages. The tank is clear, I can see if it needs more water with out sensors that don't work right and ruins my morning because I can't get my cup of coffee!
review_title: Try again Keurig! Or maybe just buy a cheap MR. Coffee that actually works!!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: The coffee is fine but brewing takes forever and the unit is very noisy! We had the original Keurig which was actually better: faster and not as noisy. If you were expecting an upgrade from your original Keurig as we were, you will be sadly disappointed.
review_title: The coffee is fine but brewing takes forever and the unit is very ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Tammy in Texas
review_text: This is my 3rd keurig.  One eventually broke and one is still used at my work desk every day. This is my first 2.0.  I've had zero of the pod compatibility issues and I use store brand and also Mauds pods I buy online. I think that pod issue may be a thing of the past. I also use a refillable K cup and carafe pod with no issues. Carafe was purchased separately.
review_title: Really big reservoir. customizable. Coffee not as hot as I would like
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: IowaGal
review_text: I love the large reservoir capacity and the carafe feature. But what they don't tell you is, at this time you can't buy refillable carafe pods for the coffee maker, and the refillable cup size pods have to be from Keurig.  No one else has pods that will fit it.  With pre-filled carafe pods costing over $2 each, the high cost of using this coffee maker is a definite negative factor. If I had known ahead of time, I would have chosen a slightly lower model, like the K525 which I believe has refillable pods of both sizes available.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ernest L. Johnson III
review_text: Really wanted a model that would work with 12oz and 14oz mugs. Come on, we're drinking COFFEE, not sipping an espresso. Don't get me wrong, espresso is great, but I'm at work all day and if I had that much espresso I'd be hearing colors by noon.  This model does a full spectrum of sizes and strengths, so one can go from espresso to a carafe. With things like auto timers it can turn on right before you get up, or in my case right before I get to work.  Additional features for water temp, and even a setting for high elevation, who'd have thought? (apparently they did)
review_title: Multiple Presets and Coffee Mug Size Options >8oz? Sign me up!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Erin L
review_text: I upgraded my old Keurig (about 5-6 years old) to this one... I wish I would have kept my old one.  The newer models make loud/odd noises when the coffee is brewing.  In fact, I originally purchased a 400 series one I thought I bought a bad model, so I upgraded higher to the K575 thinking the noise wouldn't be there.  It was.  I went as far as calling Keurig's customer service and the guy (who was really nice by the way) knew exactly what I was talking about.  My assumption is that they get this question a lot.  The noise is the water pump.  I'm surprised this noise doesn't bother other people since most reviews don't mention this.  I'm disappointed in this model... maybe someday Keurig will fix this but for now.  It's sad when I just paid $150 for a brand new one I would like to keep for a long time.  Oh well.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: LesB
review_text: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Coffee Maker is not just Single Serve !
review_title: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Coffee Maker is not just Single Serve !
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Michael Campbell
review_text: For a next generation coffee maker, it seems to be a step backwards. We are on our third or fourth Keurig and were looking forwrad to this larger more advanced product. It's way too much work. Turn buttons on, open the lid, close the lid, open it again. We joke that it's a game and you have to see how many buttons you have to push or times you have to open the lid to get a cup of coffee. Nothing like our last model. It also appears to be slower than our prior maker.
review_title: Buggy software or UX - frustrated and wish we never upgraded.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Chuck
review_text: I really wanted to like this machine, this is my second one i purchased.  first one was one of the originals and we have loved it over the years.  this one here you cannot use just any k-cup that you buy from store or amazon, you have to buy the most expensive k-cups that say are compatible with the 2.0 systems.  and then even most of those don't work.  better off buying the cheap edition and possibly even the old version if you can.  saves you a lot of money and headaches that we had to endure.  What ashame that they had to take an awesome product and ruin it like this.
review_title: do not buy unless you want to have limited options on coffee.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Retired
review_text: After two months it started having a continuous drip even when it was off.  I dumped 1 to 2 ounces of water from the drip tray 1 to 2 times a day.  Then it started to dispense from 12 to 8 ounces of water when it was programmed for 12 ounces.  I never know if the coffee is going to strong or weak due to "guess how much water" comes out.  I e-mailed customer service for assistance with no reply and am now returning it.  I also found the Keuring 2.0 to have too much digital programming.  I don't need a night light in 4 color options.  All I needed was a cup of coffee that tasted good.  This was my second Keuring.  The first was a Keuring Classic that I used until it stopped pumping water. I replaced my coffee maker but not with a Keurig.
review_title: Think twice or maybe three times.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Top Rater 1000
review_text: K575 Review   I gave it 3 stars.  I really wanted to give it more stars but it does not brew a really hot cup of coffee.  Here is Good and the Bad
review_title: Good ... but ... Does not brew a really hot cup of coffee.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: mary elizabeth wimer
review_text: I have love Keurig coffee makers but this one was the exception. Because of the tilted front the pod sits at an angle and cloggs the "needle" after almost every use requiring "needle matienence" which is opening and closing head into this little ball  and then flushing with water.....Way more trouble than it was worth. Bought one the the pod sits up right and no problems.....so buyers beware of tilted head Keurig.....
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Richard L. Weaver
review_text: Teas should be brewed at about 190 F.  Our old Keurig was easily able to dispense water at 192 F.  This model, with the temp set at it's highest, brings the temp of the water to only 166 F when we're using the "dispense hot water" feature.  We end up having to nuke the water.  I don't know if our altitude of 8500' ASL has anything to do with this brewer's performance.  We do have the high-altitude option turned on.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: JMill
review_text: This is like my 5th Keurig machine but my 1st version 2.0. I love that it brews slower so you get a better brew. It's pretty self explanatory in the item description and it is worth the cost on Amazon. Fyi... I've never had a problem with the other keurigs they were just upgrades/gifts... One for my office, husbands office, bought one for my mom and the mini for road trips we use in hotels that may not have one.    You can truly say, I'm obsessed with my keurigs. I was initially reluctant to buy the ver 2.0 for years due to complaints of not being able to use non-keurig filters or k-cups. Keurig now has a refillable filter for $8 for your own coffee but it limits you to max 12oz brew. But, of course YouTube "how to's" to the rescue... and I now can use any filter/k-cup with my new keurig 2.0 for all sizes including k-carafe. I'm very happy with this purchase (esp on Amazon). Have had it for several months since Christmas. Works smoothly.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Holly
review_text: It's okay. I suggest to anyone to get a new one every few years. Any version of a K cup coffee maker is going to have the taste everyone keeps complaining about on here. It's all plastic, as they all are, and will tend to have a slight after taste. It doesn't matter who you buy it from be it Keurig or other brands. To avoid this taste, the only rout is to go to a regular auto drip maker or fresh press. The taste is the price you pay for convenience and none of the grounds mess you get with auto drips.This particular machine arrived on time and was well packaged. I bought it about a month or so ago and use it several times a day. I find that washing the k cup holder and the tray inside it after each use reduces the plastic taste and prevent the blending of coffee flavors.
review_title: Be careful of other reviews on the plastic taste!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: This product is horrible.  Followed the setup directions and washed and rinsed and rewashed and rinsed everything but I can't get rid of the plastic smell and taste in the coffee.  I have tried different coffee brands but it is in the machine.  Even if you just dispense hot water it smells like plastic.  I thought we would be saving money by not throwing away coffee in the pot all the time but now we are all buying coffee at the donut shop.  I have to buy a new coffee maker because this thing sucks.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Lyonardo
review_text: I've used about 10 different models over the years, buy Keurig and other companies.
review_title: The best of all the K-cup brewers I've tried.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: christine16
review_text: Yes I love Keurig, however, I was extremely frustrated to learn that they have made their newer model incompatible with most non-keurig K cups.
review_title: Beware - you can't use most non-keurig brand K cups with this machine, very sneaky and unnecessary to do to your customers.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Steven H.
review_text: My wife and I used to own one of the original Keurig machines, but after seven or eight years, it gave up the ghost. So we bought this new machine. What difference!!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Martina Kilgo
review_text: I love Keurig Coffee and had a Keurig coffee maker since 2010. Since this coffe maker went over the coffee maker rainbow bridge, I ordered this one. After trying to get the thing to work for 30 minutes to no avail, it didn't recognize that the water tank was full, and asked for more water, I called Keurig customer service. The representative was friendly enough, and we went to about 5 gallon of filtered water, filling and emptying the tank, yet the machine still didn't recognize that the tank was filled to the hilt. Upon recommendation I used tap water instead of filtered water for the last round of troubleshooting, but obviously the machine doesn't recognize water containing contaminants such as chlorine either. The final solution is that Keurig will send me a replacement coffee maker within 3-7 business days, and I only have to send the brew head back, as proof that the just purchased, and not functioning machine is actually not in use. That step I find somewhat ironic, as the machine never worked in the first place. 3-7 business days for the delivery of the replacement coffee maker is an eternity for a coffee addict like me. I would have appreciated an overnight delivery, since I just paid a 3-digit amount for a coffee maker that is defective. From several reviews here, I noticed that my people with this coffee maker is not an individual case. Keurig obviously knows that this particular coffee maker is prone to defects right off the conveyer belt. It would speak for good customer service to simply put this series off the shelves completely, until they have figured out what the problem is. Instead they let customers go through the motions, let them develop frustrations, and send out a replacement of the exact kind in hope that it is not one of the many lemons they obviously produced!
review_title: Big Disappointment - Coffee Maker DOA upon Arrival
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: FL Shopper
review_text: UPDATE: I finally got a straight story from Keurig. They explained the differences in the user interface between the K575 I purchased and the K500 they sent me as a replacement. Keurig brewers no longer contain sensor chips to check for Keurig-brand k-cups and, as a result, that hardware change required corresponding changes in the user interface. I m still concerned that the orininal K575 broke after six months hence the three-star rating but I am satisfied with my replacement brewer from Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Flip513
review_text: My 575 was delivered about 3 weeks ago. Since that time I have enjoyed trying the various types of coffee and tea selections available for use. This device has allowed me to alter my schedule in a positive manner. I used to only make coffee at home when I knew was going to have a long leisurely morning and could sit and enjoy the whole pot. The Keurig 575 allows me to grab my coffee on the run in the morning. The automatic settings allow it to preheat before I get there and turn off shortly after I leave. It has saved me some time and money as I'm not stopping at Starbucks as frequently as I used to. I currently have only one complaint. I doesn't brew the coffee hot enough. I frequently will toss my cup into the microwave to to zap it for an additional 30 seconds to get it to the proper temperature. I specially purchased this Keurig because it allowed for heat adjustment - so this is a disappointment. However, running on the highest setting it still falls short. I'm running filtered water and I purge the device with an 8 oz. cup of water after everyone has had their coffee in the morning - so I have experienced no clogging. On the whole, I'm extremely happy with the purchase and barring any early breakdowns it's a solid purchase.  -- Flip513
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Terry Newberry
review_text: I really like this coffee maker.  It does everything I could hope for.  Very easy to set up.  The chrome model is very nice looking.  I had to withhold one star because Keurig managed to take away your right to choose what you might have thought was your all time favorite coffee, especially one you managed to find at a very reasonable price, and mandate that from now on you were required to use only Keurig authorized kcups in the 2.0 systems.  I know there are ways around this, but beware of your warranty.  Keurig does honor their warranties without causing you to jump through hoops, but if you somehow harm your machine by trying to find ways to make other kcups work, you'll find yourself out of luck if you need to use that warranty.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: R. L. MILLER
review_text: It may be possible to teach yourself to use this new-generation Keurig 2.0 by trial-and-error. By poking through the various screens and seeing what it does if you do THIS. Oh wow--maybe if I try THAT. I've been running online searches and reading other owners' answers. It's fairly simple if you use k-cups. And despite my qualms about the k-cups I had left over from my old 1.0 K60/ K65 machine I bought 4 years ago, all the ones I still have are apparently "Keurig approved", so they won't go to waste. But where I ran into a wall was when I tried to use the MyCup reusable filter with my favorite ground roast. Which is how I do it when I want a simple cup of joe. I loaded the MyCup filter and put it in once the preheat cycle was done and was confronted by a menu of 6 different brewing levels. I tried number 4 as a "middlin' brew" and got only 5 ounces of coffee (teacup-size) in my 10-ounce mug. No chance to set the portion size before it started brewing. I googled a question about it and found that a lot of other people ran into that. Some of their solutions included picking the machine apart to clean the "needles". I said; "Not on your life, Jack, with this beast only a couple of days out of the box." So I took a deep breath and selected the last option--number 6. I got my size selection menu where I could choose 10 ounces and that's what ended up in my cup. "Eureka", as the old saying goes. Or maybe nowadays it's "Dyson" or "Shark". Now if I'd gotten a manual with this gizmo, maybe it would have given me more info about that menu than just non-explanatory numbers for the levels. Well, maybe this one will last longer than the slightly over 4 years the old machine gave me. One thing I'm hoping was what brought on the early demise of the old machine was leaving it on all day in "demand" mode. I'm going to stop that with this new one, even if it does mean the "preheat" cycle will make it take longer to do each additional cup for lunch, midafternoon and dinner. Somebody mentioned that the brewing temp is lower due to lawsuits. I've found this new max temp of 160 degrees is too low to steep a teabag, so I'm either going to have to double up on the bags or get me a kettle for the stove.
review_title: Lack Of an Owner's Manual--a Glaring Omission
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jac
review_text: I really was excited about my Keurig coffee maker.  Very disappointed, within three months it was no longer working properly. I am constantly having issues with the water pressure... grinds in my cup and all over the dispenser... what a mess.
review_title: Very disappointed, within three months it was no longer working ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: 3Fort
review_text: Usually, when a company has the brand equity of "Kleenex, Q-tip or Skilsaw" they don't need to screw you in order to keep it. These are brand names that become household words and own the market. Keurig was no exception. When we got our first Keurig a couple of years ago, I was hooked pretty quickly (though frustrated that I can only buy one connected to a water supply if I'm a business).
review_title: Nobody likes handcuffs unless they're covered in fur!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: L. E. Mejia-loaiza
review_text: Why did I take so long to buy one?? I love this Keurig. So FAST and easy to maintain. I love the temperature options as sometimes coffee can be too hot for my liking. It goes from warm to piping hot for the crazy folks. Haha. I love the night light and the sensor that lets you know when to add water. Doesn't take too much space on my kitchen counter and it's easy to move around when in need of a water refill. The coffee and hot water options vary from 4oz to 12oz. Super cool! and Super fast! My hot water or coffee is always done in less than a minute. Can't beat that! The amount of selections this thing has in the stores (keurig brand and generic store brands) has been lots of fun to try new coffees, teas and hot chocolate flavors. Strongly recommended for any hot drink enthusiasts.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Emily
review_text: I purchased this brewer earlier this week. My old brewer no longer reliably brewed a cup of coffee. I have to say, I'm disappointed. The pump on this brewer is noisy (that's actually an understatement.)  The pump squeaks when it pulls water from the reservoir, and the pump is very loud on top of the squeaking.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ladyjustice
review_text: Have had some issues, like lots of others, with exploding K cups. Still not sure if the problem is only the pressure in each pod - but searched online for solutions and just took the most common advice - to push the pod down on the bottom needle first, then close the top. I rarely have any problems with explosions now, and I love this coffee maker. I'm still trying all different kinds of coffee to see what I like best, then I'll buy coffee by the bag, since I bought a reusable K cup/K mug filter and a set of 6 reusable gold-plated mesh filters. It's nice to get a cup of coffee whenever I want it, without making a whole pot, and I can pick what kind I want. Variety is great. People who've reviewed these Keurigs seem to either love them or hate them. I love mine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: M. Melvin
review_text: I had a standard K-Cup brewer for several years. When it finally died, I "stepped-up" to this unit. It's a complete pile of junk. It has features that are nice, but I constantly get short brews because the large carafe pods plug and stop with under pressure. Some brands of pods are better than others, but with any of them I have about a 50/50 chance of getting a full carafe. I spent the $20 for a needle cleaning tool - it didn't change anything. I like the convenience of a single cup brew, but I don't need to start my day with the frustration of the K-Cup crap-shoot. I need to decide what is next and if I want to stay with Keurig, but it will be a happy day when I toss this in the dumpster.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bite me!
review_text: I really don't understand all the negative complaints about this coffee maker?  I've used a Keurig ever since they came on the market and really never had any big issues.  You are dealing with a name brand product and a company that backs it- what's to complain about? I'm glad I didn't listen to all of the negative reviews! I love this coffeemaker!! I've had it for about three weeks now and I absolutely love it!! It holds so much water that after making 4 cups of coffee at 12 oz each and it's still more than half way filled.  Sure the coffee takes a little longer coming out but that's because I use the awesome feature of making my coffee DARKER- I love that feature!! I use only filtered water in it because I know that I will have less descaling to do in the future- you should do this too!  Look no further, you will love this coffeemaker! I have one tiny complaint which wouldn't stop me from buying this again- I wish they would have kept the temperature hotter but I guess they had to do that because of stupid people always trying to sue companies for a fat paycheck.  It isn't as hot as I'd like it to be but still very acceptable.  Maybe by the time I buy my next Keurig, they will increase the temperature again and ignore customers' complaints as I'm sure the majority of coffee drinkers prefer their coffee very hot - which is the proper way to serve it.
review_title: Buy this now! You won't regret it!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jack E. Stoner
review_text: New model allows setting the cup size, older models had to be manually set each time.  However, slightly noisy and slow to heat water, compared to an older model that this replaced.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Simbasue
review_text: Love this model.  This is my third Keurig, I use them so very much and with this model I can brew a carafe!!.  Also have the option of:  brewing tea for tea drinkers, caffeinated coffee, half cafe, and decaf coffee for those with caffeine restrictions, and hot chocolate for the kids   without having to brew a carafe for each request. BTW the grandkids love  taking orders from us oldies  at holiday dinners, then brewing and serving us with our selection. Older WORKING models have been donated to electronic recycle which my town sponsors.  Having friends and family to my home who brew only 1 - 2 cups of coffee at a time, they have also converted to Keurig (post experience at my home) as in the  long run  it is less expensive to brew a  cup  than to brew a partial ground coffee.  My BIGGEST complaint with this model is there was ZERO instructions re maintaining this appliance - the only documentation included was  quick start .  I tried to download the user manual from the Keurig web site, but the print was soooo small, I need a magnifying glass to read the download.  For the price of the applicable, a readable user manual (re cleaning, etc) for the applicable would have been appreciated.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: customer8576
review_text: We ve had this coffee maker for 3 months now, and overall I am happy with it. There are three things that I find annoying: 1) you cannot set the auto-brew for the carafe without having it pre-heat the water first. So you a) have to wait when you are just trying to quickly set it up before going to bed, and b) it seems wasteful. 2) It also immediately starts reheating again after finishing a cup, also wasteful - if you wanted to do two cups you d be waiting for the first to brew anyway and could easily just push the button again - so I think it s unnecessary 3) it always wants to maintain quite a high level of water. So after a brew, even if you put in the minimum, it still has about 50% left. If you don t use the coffee maker very often that means using old water, or wasting quite a bit every time.
review_title: I like it, with a few little caveats
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Philip John McKay
review_text: Worst purchase yet.  Had an older Keurig I loved, used it for years.  Bought this new one in March 2017, did not even start using it until April. I mostly wanted the larger reservoir and auto power options.  By May 15, about two months into use, the unit had failed.  It always was noisey and sounded like it was straining - from the very first brew (by the way took much loner to brew than my old machine).  Then within a couple of weeks It started with incomplete brews and starting making even stranger noises. I cleaned the needle per instructions.  Then it started rejecting about every 2nd or 3rd pod, basically increasing my coffee costs by almost 2 fold (please note this was using Keurig pods, and then a variety of other pods, all of which worked fine in my old Keurig machine, none of which work consistently in the new one).  Then, it started rejecting virtually every pod and getting really noisey.  It is now useless.
review_title: Waste of money, keep your old machine or invest in a another brand or, better yet, a drip maker
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: teamr
review_text: This is my third Keurig and I decided to go for something fancier.  Not a mistake!  Well worth the extra money - if you can use the features.  The water capacity and brew size are exceptional (if you will use them) but the option to make a strong brew is making me enjoy this model more than I ever imagined I would!  If your spouse wants a normal 8oz cup, then you can brew that - then brew an 8oz strong cup of coffee for yourself!!!  This model also can brew three sizes of carafe and this makes serving coffee at the end of your party so much easier and faster.  I just got this machine but I already have used almost every feature and I am impressed every time!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Clint
review_text: We just got ours and before we could even use it, the filter holder broke.  Other than that, no big problems.  It prepares hot water, runs it through the pod and then pours it in a waiting cup.  Coffee is plenty hot, even on medium high.  Menu is easy to use and the machine has all the features I expected...other than filtering water.  Which honestly, buying filtered water is probably better than relying on the system they have put into this machine...but I guess I'll never know.  I certainly won't spend more money to find out.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: BC
review_text: This K575 unit replaced an older K475 which I liked until its DRM eye stopped working. The coffee tastes much better made in this new unit compared to the old one, and it is noticeably hotter. The larger water tank on it is really great; I have to fill it only about every other day after both my husband I use it multiple times per day for tea and coffee. We generally use K-cups in it, but I've used the hot water dispensing function for tea bags a few times as well. I'm not particularly picky about my tea, so I didn't bother to use the adjustable temp setting on it to make tea with bags, but it tasted good to me. If you are picky about your tea, you can make the water hotter if you want. What really like about having the Keurig in general is making hot coffee to go. I live in a colder climate and having an insulated Dixie cup full of coffee at the touch of a button to take with me on my way to work during the winter months is one of those little things that really means a whole lot. Life just wouldn't be the same without it.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Christopher C.
review_text: My original Keurig died(K75 Platinum) after almost 3 years of use and wanted/needed to update/upgrade. As the title suggests, I am glad that I made this buy and would recommend this to others. Now for the pros and cons.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Alexander Sich
review_text: Outstanding and friendly service from the company itself: Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Silly Yak
review_text: Arrived fast and in excellent shape. Easy to set up and operate.  Also purchased permanent K-cups in two different sizes along with the carafe.
review_title: Arrived fast and in excellent shape. Easy to set up and operate
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: PerkReviews
review_text: I thought this was an upgrade from my last K Machine, but I was wrong.
review_title: Warm Coffee, Slow Recharge Time, Coffee Grits in Coffee
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Utter disappointment!  This machine empties all of the grounds from the K-cup into my coffee mug.  There are a couple of maintenance procedures that Keurig recommends.  I have performed each of these procedures over, and over, and OVER, and OVER again and I still get a coffee mug full of grounds several times per week.  I contacted Keurig to report my frustration and they replaced the machine with another.  Guess what.  Second machine does the same thing.  I have now thrown two Keurig coffee machines into a dumpster and wont buy another.  I only recommend this machine as a gag gift for someone you hate.  However, if you actually want coffee look for something else.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: John Hancock
review_text: strong chemical taste even when making only hot water. called Keurig customer support. The rep said to clean it by running diluted white vinegar through it and if that doesn't work to BUY their special cleaning solution.  why should i have to buy additional cleaner for a brand new machine? i said since this is a manufacturing problem then the cleaner should be included or provided free. the said no can do and i said back it goes.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Barbie
review_text: Wow...Wow....Wow..... I so wanted to give this K575 coffemaker a try.  I love the look and everything Keurig says about it.  After reading page after page of reviews and most negative  I decided to go with my gut instinct and give it a try.  Boy....am I glad I did.  It works like a charm.  I love that now they have added a red, green, and white light along with the normal blue to light up the water tank.  I can change the color for certain holidays.  I see why so many gave negative reviews......It can Not take any of the cheap brands of coffee pods.  It takes all of the keurig pods on their website and also on amazon where I do the majority of my shopping.  The way I figure is if I am spending all of this money on a great quality coffeemaker then I only want to use the best coffee.  To me, buying a good coffeemaker only to use cheap coffee is defeating the purpose.  So I am so happy that I purchased this.  I am waiting for my box of carmel macchiato coffee pods to come so I can have a real treat.  I love this coffeemaker and if you want quality coffee then it is definitely for you.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jerry Morris
review_text: This is my 3rd Keurig machine.  The first one did not survive the move from Alaska to Delaware--Moisture inside froze & it cracked internally--not the fault of the machine.  Our 2nd machine was an early model of the 2.0 series--It was pretty much junk from the first month.  We continued using it for over a year, & it finally just died.  Early on, Tech Support offered some semi-worthless assistance--He even told me that Reverse Osmosis filtered water was bad for the machine (WTF????)  Anyway, that is ancient history.  This current machine has been functioning flawlessly for about 3 months, and we are very happy with it
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Papa Bear
review_text: If I could give this 0 stars I would! We purchased this keurig after our model from 2010 had just died. We were excited and lured in by all the bells and whistles of this newer, sleeker design. The only good thing this machine has going was the fact that it looks beautiful.
review_title: Burning plastic smell/taste doesn t go away!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: MVP (pj) 23
review_text: I love this Keurig because it brews my coffee so quickly and the idea is just great. It makes starting my days easier with a nice blend of whatever I am feeling for the day and I don't have to worry about making a whole pot. I only clean it about every 3-4 months and it's really easy to do with the Keurig solution. It is not recommended for an office setting or anywhere that will use it 10+ times a day because it gets finicky and breaks easily. If this were the case, I would go with the business maker.
review_title: Great for the Home or College
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: T.S.
review_text: I'm over the k-cup controversy. I get why they made the decision to "trademark" their k-cups.  That didn't sway my purchase as I was replacing a 2.0 brewer with a faulty screen that had finally bit the dust.  I thought I was going in eyes wide open - it's convenient, lasts long enough to be worth the <$200 (1.5 years usually, and with very frequent use).
review_title: There are better tasting coffee pod makers (Nespresso) but for the convenience ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Texas Kitchen
review_text: This is our family's second Keurig. I love that there are lots of coffees, teas, etc... available for use. This way everyone in the house gets exactly what they want. One of my favorite features of this one is you do not have to stand there while pushing the button to get plain hot water. You know for when you want to make a tea not available in the K-cup yet. Hubby and I drink a lot of tea.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I just received my keuric 575 coffee maker. It was used, to my surprise it looked brand new. Works great. This my 2nd keuric . Got a good deal and very happy.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Staci Perry
review_text: I give it two stars because it is a nice looking machine, and it does technically brew coffee.  But the coffee tastes like plastic!  This is my second Keurig, my first one lasted years, and I was ready to replace it.  I read online that other folks were having the plastic taste issue with the 2.0, and there was advice to scrub, run vinegar through the system, etc.  When that didn't help, I called Keurig and they sent me a new reservoir, which is where much of the plastic stink was coming from.  Now the coffee tastes better, but not good.  I decided to return this machine and get something else.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ada Evelyn Rodriguez
review_text: Amazing. Love this Keurig. I had the K 65 Special Edition my son gave me this one for christmas. Absolutely amazing. Easy to use top of the line touch screen. I make regular coffee with the k cup he bought me separate. I just put it where the regular kcup goes. Dont have to take the middle part out like the other keurig. Coffee taste delicious. Im so glad he got this one for me . Would recommend it.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Greg
review_text: I was really excited about buying this unit and buying the Carafe and larger pods to make it with but what a disappointment. First, its loud with a pumping noise  to make cup of coffee or carafe and the needle warnings on the screen saying the needle needs maintenance. It is simple enough running just water to clean it but I must of lost 15-20 k-cups because it doesn't make the full cup when it shuts the brewing down. It also takes a while to heat back up to make another cup. I am returning this unit and going back to my Cuisinart k-cup machine. I did take a loss after buying the bigger k-cups for the carafe, carafe itself and reusable cartridges
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: robyn shulman
review_text: I HATE this thing. I loved my old keurig, it died after 7 years so I bought this since it was the only machine I saw that allowed me various temperature and size controls. It is so freaking sensitive. I've tried using this two days now and it's always "pre heating water" or needs a minute. I spend more time waiting on the machine and seeing error messages then anything else. For the past ten minutes it has said "just a moment" and before that brew issues occurred!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Michael
review_text: This is my third luring in 5 years. The screen always dies on them. Despite my better judgement we got a third one. It was missing the filter date dial which should definitely have been included. It also did not include the carafe which it pictured and I assume should have been included. My last one did. It also came with one filter not two as it states. Overall, I m disappointed at the quality of these products and the fact that it s missing things. They should last more than 2 years. Time to look at other brewers like the ninja or something.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Julian
review_text: After my Keurig (8 years old) started to get grumpy on whether it would brew me a coffee or not... I ordered this one.... I really like the extra strong brew feature and the 12oz option.... Both which can be set as the default when you start it up.... It takes a minute longer than my old one to brew.... But it is worth it.... My coffee tastes even better... The coffee has more 'body' to it. I drink dark roast only. My wife loves it because it brews her ice tea even better. Hot chocolate has a separate touch button to use.... It does a real good job with everything. Programming is easy to do to set up the defaults...which you can change on the fly... It amazes me how much better coffee it gets out of the same pod.
review_title: Has the option to make your coffee stronger and larger.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Andrea
review_text: I absolutely love this machine! I've had it only a few days but it works flawlessly and brews great tasting coffee. Just be aware that certain K-Cups don't taste well (at no fault of the Keurig). It's a fun, quick adjustment in comparison to any standard coffee maker. And there are tons of accessories and flavors to try. You can even brew your everyday coffee with a reusable K-Cup filter by Keurig and other sellers. They've really thought of everything.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I love Keurig coffee makers but I may have gotten a lemon. The coffee from identical machines is so hot I have to wait for cooling but mine does not do that. The settings are set to hot; I've done everything right but you could drink the coffee straight down immediately it's finished brewing.
review_title: Doesn't make the coffee hot.and yes I know how to operate the settings.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: B.W.
review_text: This is a great unit. We really like it and we use it several times a day. It's so nice to get a fresh cup of coffee or tea anytime of the day and not have to reheat it. We waited for some time to buy one of these, but we waited until one came out that has the features we wanted. I don't believe anyone would be disappointed with this unit. it does a great job. We've been using it steady about a month now and no problems to report. We do use filtered water in it and have installed the water filter it came with. There is a ton of different k cups out there. Anyone should be able to find a favorite.
review_title: We waited for just the right one!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: jojo
review_text: I like the features. I wish i would have saved the money and just got the K525. The only difference is the filter. I followed the directions to the letter for preparing and installing the water filter, but it made everything (coffee, tea, hot chocolate) taste awful. It was like you just chewed on a piece of charcoal. We had to remove it, wash the water reservoir, and run several cycles of hot water through the system to get rid of the bad taste. Now everything tastes good. I think we are just going to use distilled water instead of using a filter.
review_title: Machine is great, water filter, not so much.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Tom
review_text: First time buying a Keurig. I'm very impressed. Makes perfect, hot coffee. The pod variety is nice too. I was concerned because I'd like to make regular ground coffee (or beans that I would grind) and apparently you can do that with a cheap reusable coffee filter... so I t got that too. Have enough pods to last a long time though. Overall, this is just really nice. About the only component I think you have to replace every so often is the water filters... you can set the machine to tell you when it is time to as well.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Wendy Ritch
review_text: I was despondent when my Breville 1.0 k-cup brewer gave up the ghost after six years of heavy use.  After reading many reviews I bought the Keurig 575 Platinum on Amazon and with some modifications to the metal SoloClip (also sold on Amazon) I am able to use any brand of k-cup as well as have access to the full menu of brewing options.  Here's what you do: 1) cover the purple rectangle on the SoloClip with orange stickers; 2) cut off the left ridge of the SoloClip, which is what prevents it from fitting in the K575; and 3) use small bits of duct tape to hold the modified SoloClip in place over the sensor.  If the SoloClip fits in your machine then just do step 1 and install as per package directions.  Voila - contraband k-cups and all menu options are now available to you!  BOOM!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Beowulf4920
review_text: Had this for several month's now. It is still going. Don't listen to the bad reviews. This keurig is amazing for all that it does. The price is great and the keurig is great. Remember when using chocolate blend. Clean it by using the hot water option it has. Love this
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: digigate
review_text: Great unit when it works (for about 2 months).  Seems this model is very prone to the clogged needle pressure message.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Livingthepast
review_text: Quiet.  Makes great coffee.  Hot water option is very handy.  This is a big improvement over the older style.  Much, much quieter.
review_title: Makes great coffee. Hot water option is very handy
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Dave Gray
review_text: Brewer failed with the error "Sorry Brew Interrupted" on the fourth cup of coffee.  The problem is not the coffee maker but it is a good possibility that it is a result of air in the k-cup pods.  The air trapped in the pod and it will contaminate the needle, I am guessing that the air when the pod is penetrated results in the needle being blocked/contaminated.  If the top of the k-cup pod is raised and does not give when you press on it there is a possibility that the pod is air bound.  If you are experiencing this error put the pod into the device and push down on it  before closing the device.  When you push down on the pod a hole will be made in the bottom and the air will be released.  I replaced a K575 that was well used for this problem.  It appears that my old coffee maker will work if I release the air from the k-cup pods.  I have not re-installed by old K575 to test my theory.  FYI  I am using Costco K-Pods.  Picture of error message attached.
review_title: Your coffe maker may not be the problem.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bart
review_text: Okay, so first off if you are super worried about the fact that this thing has an optical reader and won't brew non-keurig approved kcups. You probably shouldn't be that worried. I was at first. As a matter of fact I was looking into a way to disable the reader. But be warned, if you are planning to attempt a hack by snipping the green and yellow wire. That is no longer possible. All the wires are black now, all of them, also I believe the optical sensor is now digital instead of analog. By that I mean, there is no longer a green or yellow wire to snip. The j27 slot where the green/yellow wires would plug into, are no longer being used in this model. This version of this model was specifically designed to prevent people from hacking it. That being said, once I gave up on the idea of hacking it, I tried all the kcups I had in my cupboard, and guess what, they all worked! Apparently, the optical sensor was a big issue 2 years ago, when most companies hadn't gotten on board with the keurig 2.0 labels yet. But in that time, most of them have. I could not find a single kcup in my cupboard, that wasnt compatible. And I mainly used kroger generic cups, which I assumed wouldn't work, but they did. Now obviously there are still some kcups out there that are super cheap, but they are probably super cheap because they are being phased out and need to be sold quick. But you can easily check the side of any kcup box and it will let you know. Also, I found out the main reason for the optical sensor wasn't to stop you from using them, but apparently the lids tell the keurig what type of pod it is, and the proper way to brew it. That way you don't have to manually enter anything. Regardless if you are brewing tea or coco, or a carafe or a pre-sweetened latte type drink, it automatically knows. It's actually a really cool idea. But I still think they should have given you an option for manually brewing non-labeled kcups. But I think they felt if they allowed it, a lot of kcup manufacturers would not have updated their lids. But now they have.
review_title: This is a tenative review, so it may change over time, but I will update it if this product doesn't meet my expectations
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Mr. Bruno
review_text: We love this thing as the replacement in our office of about 25 people. It has a large reservoir, nifty little lights, and makes a great strong brew when you choose the "Strong" setting. We didn't have any issues with any of our existing coffee pods, and we have about 20 different brands in our cupboard.
review_title: We love this thing as the replacement in our office of ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: W. P. Emil
