review_text: Works great, would recommend it,  It has a few oddities though, the menu is not as clear as it should be.  You can use the Keurig Carafe with this model, but you must use their K Carafe pods!  You can't just put the carafe in place of the cup and then use the single K-cup pods.  It knows if there is a cup or the carafe in place.  Thats a disappointment for me.  It does have some nice features, though.  My favorite is the strong brew cycle.  It brews slower and lets the water brew more before it flows out.  Great.
review_title: Nice up to date Keurig (with oddities.)..but has many features.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Techie
review_text: Love this dang thing.  I had an older version at home, 1 dot something.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Carrie
review_text: I was so delighted when I opened my own new Keurig K575 brew! Loving so far I've own it for few days. No issues...but there was no maintenance accessory kit came with it as it should be. I did asked the reviewers question concern about if it will come with maintenance accessory kit (an orange pod). Did got few replies that they do come with it and customer service said the same it should come with it. So apparently it didnt came with it once I opened the box and inspected to ensure I didnt overlook it. I did called Keurig Customer Service and they did fixed it immediately by sending me the maintenance accessory kit via FEDEx. It should be arrive anytime soon.
review_title: Loving my new Keurig....but there's a missing part.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: D. L. Mahler
review_text: I read all the other reviews and almost didn't purchase this. I'm glad I did. Noisy? No. It makes the normal sounds this type of brewer makes. Not noisy at all. Makes HOT coffee consistently. Love the energy saving feature. I programmed mine to shut off after 2 hours of inactivity and set the wallpaper to my color choice.
review_title: Love it! Love it! Love it! Big Improvement over my previous model!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: tld8803
review_text: We love this new model Keurig.  This is our first one, and love the convenience of the pods, although it's a little pricey, especially with the cost of the Keurig Carafe Pods.  Actually, the coffee in the carafe pods is so expensive that we will not be buying those.  Instead we will use the reusable filter and put our own ground specialty coffee in it.  The options on the display are very easy to work with and didn't have any trouble getting it all set up.  It is really beautiful as well, so looks good sitting on the counter - bonus!  The machine is great - now just make the pods a little more cost friendly, especially the carafe pods.
review_title: BEAUTIFUL AND EASY TO SET UP!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Fred A. Bronnert
review_text: Like it so far, but have found compatibility issues with k-pods "not designed for this brewer"
review_title: Thought the top of the Line would be Great, NOT...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: iadesigner
review_text: I have had Keurigs in the past that were wonderful. This model has issues with certain Keurig K-cups foil tops basically exploding from water pressure buildup. Returned the first one and the second has the same issue. We clean and maintain the machine as recommended (and more). Customer service said it was our water so we use filtered water with the same results. To avoid chucking the machine in the landfill, we started using the mesh bottom pods. They work fine but are not as available or varied as the K-cups.
review_title: Grounds in our coffee, not a fun surprise
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Tyler
review_text: Hesitant to purchase based on some of these reviews but so far so good! Been in use daily, working great and brews a wonderful cup of coffee and hot chocolate. Very easy to set up and use. I bought a drawer stand for my K-cups and even on the stand it fits well under the counter. See photos. It's out a few inches from the back and I can fully open the top. When inserting the K-cup make sure to push down until you hear/feel the pop, I also press down on the top to get rid of extra air before brewing (see photo), this helps ensure the pods do not break open. Also attached some pics with my old Mr Coffee for a size comparison, I always had to pull the Mr Coffee out to full open the top. Really happy with the Keurig and feel it was a good buy!
review_title: Easy to use and almost perfectly under counter
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: JulieLudeman
review_text: The carafe does not come as pictured and maybe it said that when I ordered it, but it doesn't matter. The machine sounds very loud when it's brewing - almost like my other 3 Keurigs did before they bit the bullet. The drip tray does not stay put, but I suppose that's for ease of using the carafe. I would have thought more people use the machine as a single brewer though and so that would have been taken into consideration during the design; perhaps it's to better allow for travel mugs, who knows. All in all it's just change and I'm trying to get used to it.
review_title: The machine sounds very loud when it's brewing - almost like my other 3 Keurigs did before they bit the ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: R. Shuri
review_text: I've owned several Keurig and Kitchenaid K cup brewers.  I've lived with this one for 5 months now and don't like it at all.
review_title: I've lived with this one for 5 months now and don't like it at all
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jenniescharms
review_text: I got this through Amazon Warehouse and I was a little worried. I don't see a single defect on it and it runs beautifully. I've been using Keurig for over 4 years. This is such a wonderful product. The K575 is a sleek and stylish addition to my kitchen. It brews a perfect cup of coffee every time. The hot water spout for tea is fabulous. I am too lazy to wait for a tea kettle and my prior machine always made the tea taste slightly like coffee. Now I get my coffee in the morning and clean cup of tea in the evening. I definitely would recommend getting this model and taking a chance on the Warehouse Deals. I paid $70 less by going this route.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Rusty_In_OR
review_text: Really like this version. I wanted one that would brew and pour a larger up of coffee, and that had some saved profile features for other family members.  Also needed a larger reservoir.  This was great.  Only suggestion is that I'd love the hottest setting to be just a little hotter, since I'm a slow coffee drinker, but that's nothing that 20 seconds in the Microwave Oven doesn't solve.  All things considered, this one meets and slightly exceeds my expectations.  Read some complaints in other reviews about the "2.0" and "coded K-cup" thing ... but have yet to experience anything that didn't work just fine.  I think that criticism is a few years old, and doesn't apply anymore.
review_title: Great features - a must have for all Keurig addicts.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Liisb Mass
review_text: This model is very nice and makes a tasty cup of coffee.  I like that I can set the size of the cup from 8oz to 12oz.  Two things I didn't like --  1st) the water filter is basically useless to me.  It made the coffee taste strange so I just removed it.  2nd) I purchased the additional reusable coffee filter which leaks coffee grinds into the cup.  I tried various amounts of coffee to see if that would resolve the added grinds but had no luck.  I now just buy the pre-filled cups.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Robin
review_text: This is my second Keurig and I don't like it.  About every third time I use it, it doesn't work.  The unit rips up the authentic Keurig k cup and stops in mid brew.  I get an pressure error message and a cup of grounds.  It only works about one in three when I use a filter with grounds in it.  You can't brew anything bigger than 12oz without a carafe size filter in the unit.  I have to put in an empty one for hot water.  The 2.0 models suck.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ed C
review_text: I purchased this item 3 weeks ago.  I use it 1 or 2 times a day.  I had it set on 10 oz of coffee.  After the first week, it gave me 4 oz.  I thought I had reset it.  A couple days later I ended up with 12 oz.  Since that time, I have received different amounts.  This morning, my coffee was lukewarm and 4 oz.  I like the coffee maker.  Just wish it worked.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Joe Money
review_text: I have to say this Keurig was the perfect purchase to cure my over consumption of coffee. Have had nothing but problems since getting it.
review_title: This model is terrible and will feed you coffee grounds nonstop
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Linda R. Belair
review_text: Bought as a replacement for a 5 yr old Kuerig, so lots of things changed. I love the screen for functions instead of buttons, the ability to select brew strengths and the HUGE water reservoir. It is also a little more sleek in design. Now for the important part, the coffee is great. We use SF Bay coffee pods and this machine seems to eliminate the bitterness they sometimes have.  I will update if it goes kaput too early or I have trouble with it. But for now, we love it!
review_title: Looks nice, has a large water reservoir and makes good coffee!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: JoeTAZ
review_text: I was using a Keurig Platinum for a number of years but it started doing strange things and for the life of me I couldn't keep the needles clean. It was time to say goodbye and I went with the Platinum because...ummm, I'm not real sure why. It's the one my wife said she wanted.
review_title: A worthy replacement for my Platinum
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Sue1023
review_text: Waited a couple of months to review. Love it as much today as I did the day I purchased. Makes both my coffee and my husbands just the way we like it. Bought a reusable kkup from amazon  I am concerned about the environment and like the ability to have a reusable kkup. To get the strength and amount of coffee I use 2 cups so it s worked perfectly for me.
review_title: Great coffee maker with nice features
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Libby Hermanstorfer
review_text: I originally got this as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend but I use it 10 times more than he does. I have had this for over a year now and use it every day with no problem. The water heats up very fast and I bought the coffee pot so I could brew whole pot of coffee, I would say that the K cups you buy taste a whole lot better than the refillable K cup. But overall I am very satisfied with it so far
review_title: I would say that the K cups you buy taste a whole lot better than the refillable K cup
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Steve and Cindy
review_text: We would not recommend this machine.  We've had it less than a month and keeps giving an error and the machine stops mid cup. Contacted Keurig several times and been through the machine cleaning cycles with customer service.  The cost of Kcups is too expensive not to get a cup of coffee every time.  We have wasted box of kcups trying to get coffee over the past month!  Very, very disappointed in Keurig - it's been 2 months and now we are stuck with a $200 machine and not able to get a good cup of coffee.  Keurig should stand behind the machine for more than 2 months!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Deanna Caldwell
review_text: We have had problems with this Keurig. I gave as a Christmas gift and am finding out it won't brew an entire cup of coffee before the k-cup explodes. Per the users manual, the necessary steps were taken to fix, but it still isn't fixed.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Loved the convenience of the machine - had it 2 years.  Only downside to the brewer tells me to refill the reservoir when it's still well above half-full, so I select 12 oz. instead of 18 oz., then brew again selecting 6 oz. to fill my mug.  BUT HERE IS THE MAIN PROBLEM: after a year, K-Mug (my morning drink) options started becoming extremely limited on the Keurig site, but I still found them on Amazon.  Well that is no more!  They have been discontinued by Keurig.  They no longer sell K-Mug pods or machines that use the K-Mug.  Same thing appears to be happening with K-Carafe - now only 11 K-Carafe pods sold by Keurig, and just 1 machine.  So I wouldn't use the ability to also brew a mug or carafe as a determining factor.  (it's deceptive that Keurig still sells machines on their site - advertising they brew the K-Mug - when they no longer make those cups).  If it weren't for now being limited to K-Cups, I would have rated the machine a 4.
review_title: Looking for cup size options - don't bother
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: No Name
review_text: I had such high hopes for this machine. It looks very nice and has lots of useful and cool features. There is one big flaw with this machine and that is that the k-cups explode- leaving a mess in your coffee and inside the machine. Horrible waste of money and frustrating to say the least. It doesn't happen with every brew but it happens enough times that this machine is useless. Look to buy something else. Mine is going back.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Brad
review_text: Bought this for my wife because it seemed like a quick and easy way to get a cup of coffee.  Well that, and the wife wanted a Keurig.  No regrets about this coffee maker.  Makes a piping hot cup of coffe.  You have to be sure and go through the settings to program what you want.  Even the coffee temperature has options.  It has been running smoothly since about December December 10, 2016 with zero issues.  Makes perfect tea and coffee but the hot coacoa is rather bland.  Don't know what else to say.  It's a great coffee maker and the price is right.  I give it an A+.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: A P
review_text: Great machine. Takes about a minute to heat the water up, but is well worth it because of two reasons: (1) once up and running it does not take time to reheat between cups, so you get continuous hot water ready to go, and (2) the water tank is very big which means it does not have to be refilled so fast. Finally, the bottom piece is removable for mugs and bigger cups.
review_title: Great machine. Takes about a minute to heat the ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: L. Greenwald
review_text: I was so excited when I got this but it ended up being a dud.  It didn't dispense water according to the size I had programmed in and kept dripping long after brew was done.  Fortunately, Amazon customer service was awesome.  As soon as I contacted them they shipped a new one to replace it and provided a shipping label to return the faulty one.  I received the new one today and have run hot water through it a few times.  It doesn't drip and it gives the right amount of ounces.  The only problem is that when it is pumping the water through it sounds like hydraulic brakes.  I am hoping that doesn't last after it is used a few times.
review_title: Fortunately, Amazon customer service was awesome
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Linda
review_text: I have really enjoyed my Keurig so far. I like that the water reservoir is removable. It's nice to be able to just make myself a cup of coffee when I want a single cup. It's worked flawlessly so far. I did purchase a separate kcup 2 filter so that I can use my own coffee. I also purchased a carafe since it didn't come with one.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: David A. Twente
review_text: So far this has been a great machine.  I had to learn how to "trick" it into giving me a full 16 oz cup of coffee though, by making 2, 8 oz cycles.  I just wish it had the flexibility to make a 16 oz cup right out of the box.  Otherwise this is a great machine.  It heats up quickly and makes a great cup of coffee.  It gets a bit cranky when it wants more water, by not going on to make the cup with water it has already heated.  I suppose that is for safety sake.
review_title: So far this has been a great machine. I had to learn how to "trick" ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: C. Lemke
review_text: Keurig has "improved" this product to the point of nonfunctionality.  Keurig needs to get its' act together - we purchased this product last December and what a nightmare with frequent malfunction requiring dismantling of the device just to brew a cup of coffee.  It has gotten to the point that my husband recently purchased an old fashioned Mr. Coffee to ensure coffee is an actual option each morning.  The pods frequently "explode" in the Keuring creating a mess of leaky grounds.  Our previous iterations of Keurig have been much more reliable.  Time for Keurig to figure this out - maybe less is more.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Coffee is an instrumental tool everyday my office life. I have previously been a loyal consumer of the Keurig brand. As such, when I needed a new coffee machine for my office; I chose a Keurig. However, this particular choice was a mistake. As much as I might love the Keurig brand overall, this particular machine is utterly terrible. It completely broke down and never worked properly. Not only did the button refuse to work (and needed several presses to do what it was supposed to) but oftentimes the water just continuously poured out, not stoping until the reservoir was empty. I sincerely regret the purchase of this machine, and have since replaced it with another.
review_title: A horrendous machine which I would never recommend
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Matt G
review_text: We loved our first Keurig. Brewed coffee and tea like a champ and lasted for over 4 years. So when it finally crapped out we researched the newest Keurig models and ordered the K575 around Thanksgiving 2016.  I was not happy that they did not allow other k-cups to be used in the machine but did not realize how big of a pain the butt this would be.  So I have 3 gripes about this model:
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Adam Bomers
review_text: DO NOT BUY THIS MACHINE!!! I had read the reviews and thought it couldn't be that bad. Now its to late and i can't return it. The Keurig worked great for the first 30 days and of course that's when the return option stops. The first thing to go wrong with it, was im guessing the needle was getting plugged or something and the entire coffee cup amount was overflowing from the top of the keurig becasue a huge mess and cause coffee grounds to come out the top as well and getting stuck in very small places on the machine. The second thing that is wrong with it, is my viewing screen has two or three entire lines out in it, like the pixels are gone or something.... i am beyond sad that i got the new version and very sad with this product... i wish i could return it or at least exchange it for another one and see if i have better luck!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Patricia E Lennon-DeCosta
review_text: Coffee does not brew strong. I have unpacked my old brewer.
review_title: Coffee does not brew strong. I am ready to ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Gordon A. Hughes
review_text: Replacement for a previous model that just gave up after less than a year. Tried all options to recover functionality and eventually purchased the K575.  Positive:  12oz cups which are not watered down.  Larger water tank capacity.  Con:  Noisy.  Noisy as in anticipation another Keurig coffee maker will die an early death.  In the meantime it is the best model we have purchased over the years.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ryan S.
review_text: It's fancy looking, quite and brews. It sucks to change between standard, mug, and coffee pot sizes. Ok for home use but would never use in an office where more then one cup is needed at a time. Reason is it takes a long time to heat up or pour a cup compared to older models. Perhaps the longer pour makes a better cup but the the 3min to heat seems long.
review_title: It sucks to change between standard
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: SRLM
review_text: Bought this for an Anniversary event. Upon receiving package, contents were wet and not all contents mentioned in listing were included in box. (Bought used from listed seller.) Some scratching was evident on the product. (Because of all of that is why I gave a three-star rating. Called Keurig and they replaced most missing contents, but did not send the pods that were supposed to have been included. It was a painless process. Keurig (company) was super friendly and responsive. They are amazing! I have now taken the Keurig to work so everyone else can use it since I m not a coffee drinker. Works very well! Had one incident with someone opening a pod and putting it inside the Keurig pod holder, and ran the brewing process. Grounds went all in the compartment and had to be cleaned throughout. Upon wiping Keurig down after cleaning, and plugging it in, it wouldn t start. Let it dry overnight and retried. Unit came on and has since worked perfectly. The Keurig K575 is a great little machine, I give it 5 stars!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: pajtim
review_text: I see alot of Negative comments about the Keurig 2.0
review_title: Im happy with Keurig K575 for now!

name: AliBea
review_text: Used multiple times a day in an office setting, last one lasted about 2 years before a coworker accidentally damaged it, we expect to get even more life out of this one! On the plus side this one doesn't block you from using non branded K cups like the previous version did!
review_title: Can use off brand K Cups!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Deni
review_text: THIS ITEM IS 100 STARS! I NEVER EVER EXPECTED SUCH AN AWESOME MACHINE! KEURIG IS ALWAYS TOPS, BUT THEY OUT DID THEMSELVES ON THIS! I HATE GADGETS AND MESSY LONG TIME CLEANING. THIS KEURIG IS SO SIMPLE, BEAUTIFUL LOOKING, HAS SO MANY FEATURES THAT THE USER CAN CUSTOMIZE, AND NEVER EVER A PROBLEM! SO SO SO WONDERFUL. FEEL LIKE I DIED AND WENT TO HEAVEN! KEURIG ALSO HAS ALWAYS HAD A TOP CUSTOMER SERVICE!
review_title: 100 STARS AND GOODBYE SBUX AND WELCOME KEURIG ONLY FOREVER!

name: Ray
review_text: Bought this for my wife as a Christmas gift. She loves coffees but doesn't drink enough to finish a full pot. this item is very simple to use and can accommodate almost any style of K-cup or other that's on the market. i've found we order tons of flavors through amazon.com as well. we have drank well over 100 cups from it so far and i would say its really lived up to its worth. Very simple instructions and has limitless possible set ups for every coffee lover
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

review_text: Brew interrupted msg comes up frequently and just 8 months of purchase and 7 of use. Noisy and bulky too.

review_text: Are these overpriced?  Yeah probably.  Is the coffee overpriced?  Absolutely.  Is it environmentally friendly to use these things with K cups?  Nope.
review_title: So much more convenient than older styles.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: pizza lover
review_text: works better than my older platinum. more options are a good thing.  the water pump still appears to be the weak spot.  platinum was replaced twice by keurig while under warranty. purchased this when platinum died. we'll see how long it lasts ... but the pump sounds like your attempting to drive a gto with a lawnmower engine.
review_title: flexible coffee brewing options. the pumps are not the best

name: Charles Ingram
review_text: I really do love it, but their manufacturing added an eighth of an inch in height to the specifications which means it won't fit under our kitchen cabinet, so that means it has to sit out from the overhang and take up more counter space than we wanted. I either have to live with that or get a carpenter to  bring a router to shave off an even 1/8th inch off the bottom of the cabinet. Not exactly a Solomonic choice, but pretty darned close.
review_title: 1/8 of an inch taller than the specs creates a Solomonic choice.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Patricia A Malloy
review_text: Because of my work I live in 2 places and have 2 offices.  For a number of years I've had Keurigs at all 4 sites for personal and professional use and been very happy with them so when I needed to replace 1 at a home I just ordered another Keurig.  I followed all the set up directions and began making coffee with pods that are meant to be used in Keurigs.  For whatever reason the new device kept getting clogged (and I mean after 2 or 3 normal cups)!  I called for service, went through the process of cleaning the device and trying again and the same problem persisted.  The service person and I decided to replace that Keurig with another of the same style.  I just thought I'd gotten a lemon!  Well, the very same problem happened with the second device so now I'm returning 2.  Since I do have 3 other Keurigs that work perfectly and have used others for years ... I'm going to request a different model  and expect the 3rd try to be perfect!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Carrie L Larson
review_text: Bought this to replace one that quit working.  Had a week and it's broken.  Has a call tech support on screen!  Are you kidding me!!!!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Tron buyer
review_text: Requests more water when half full. Keurig could really stand to make a good product. It's a picky swing and a miss.
review_title: Keurig could really stand to make a good product. It's a picky swing and a miss
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Anonymous
review_text: I love this machine!!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Time/Space Fabrics
review_text: I bought a used one on Amazon. It's perfect, and I saved $50. It's a great coffeemaker. You will save on coffee, too. Buy the gold pod, and use your own coffee. I bought DI ORO - MaxBrew 24K GOLD K-Cup Reusable Filter. It's better than the others because it has a hinged lid, which won't wear out like the others.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: JB
review_text: This unit replaced an older Keurig coffee maker.  This unit when it works does a great job, water is hotter than old unit.  My issues with this unit are the fact that the needle requires cleaning to often and many of the k-cups out of the same box will give an error saying this is not an approved cup, please use a K-cup. Does have a nice sized reservoir.
review_title: This unit when it works does a great job, water is hotter than old unit
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Casey
review_text: I love it!  Super easy to set up Christmas morning and the temperature adjustments are awesome.  I would love if they made a glass reservoir though because I do wonder about plastic leaching. I would pay extra for that as an accessory!!!  Otherwise, functionality seems great so far and the hot water dispensing is a very nice bonus.
review_title: Please make a glass reservoir option and this would be perfect!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: BW
review_text: This is our 3rd Keurig, and probably our last. It is fine for the most part, but the little issues I have with it disappoint me. 1) I occasionally get "blow outs" where the top of the K-cup opens and dumps all the grounds into the mug. Our last Keurig started doing it all the time, so we got this new one, and it has already done it once. 2) Another time I got a message about a brewing problem and a warning about the kup being "under pressure". I slowly opened it and it sprayed hot coffee grounds all over my shirt. This occasional problem has been around for a while, why hasn't Keurig engineered a fix for it?
review_title: It is fine for the most part
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: DSeyfer
review_text: I received the Kerrigan today.  It was supposed to be new, but the K cup pieces had coffee residue on them.  Obviously it was used...  This was a gift for my wife and used appliances aren't exactly the best gifts...
review_title: I received a used Keurig...  Quality control fails again.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jeff_A_1973
review_text: Spend too much time cleaning and hoping for a good, grind free, cup of coffee.  I have read about seals, using paper clips to clean tips, running just water to clean it, etc.  The older and simpler K45 (discontinued?!) machine at my office is a consistent workhorse compared to this machine and RARELY requires any cleaning.  The K575 looks great on my counter top, but that is simply all that the engineers executed correctly on this product.  Too bad, wish I could return it, barely 6 months old.
review_title: For its intended simplistic use, not impressed. The struggle is real.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: LeeAnn Williams
review_text: Quit working after using it for less than 5 months.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

review_text: This coffeemaker did not last even a full year.  It died this morning...serious design flaw.  There is a very flimsy piece of plastic that holds the needle that pierces the bottom of the K-cups.  Well, this morning it broke off rendering the coffee maker useless short of spending way to much for a OEM replacement part ( not available on Keurig site).
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: TheDarkDraft
review_text: This Keurig turns on and off on a schedule, or inactivity. Sometimes it doesn't always shut off and will stay on for days until it is turned off. Aside from this first world complaint, the Keurig does its job properly. The most appealing feature is that it saves your brewing preference so all you have to do is drop the K pot in and press brew. Aside from being shinier and having a few other features, the coffee taste no different than the standard Keurig machine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: SLP
review_text: I've had a Keurig for 8 years. Our original started making a strange noise so I ordered another one. Hubby fixed the old one ( he said it was just a minor adjustment) and our daughter took it to her office for all to use. Love our new one, it is quieter and has more mug and cup sizes.  It will even make a pot full, but I doubt if we ever use that.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Colleen Sullivan
review_text: Love it.  Being able to choose size, strength, heat for my cup of coffee is wonderful.  I have used Keurig for seven years and have discovered so many brands and flavors of coffee, tea, hot cocoa and hot water.  This is a great machine for a single person or a family.  Each person can specify the way they like their coffee.  In addition, it is really fun to search for the best coffee at the best prices.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Regine Lopez
review_text: I love it!!! I love all the features like the night light & how you can change the color of the nightlight  & change the color of the wallpaper &  you can also change the color of the area where the water container is.  Has a lot of adjustable settings!
review_title: Great Coffee Maker!!!  My favorite Keurig yet!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Clark
review_text: I ordered the new Keurig K575 machine to replace an old B70 Keurig machine that is now leaking water everywhere. Being an engineering Tech I probably should have fixed the old one instead of purchasing the new one. I like a cup of old grey in the morning and have three of four cases left of "Celestial perfect Iced tea" that I had purchased in 2013. If I fix the old machine I will send the new one back since I cannot get it to work with the older cups. Also we unplug all kitchen appliances after use, especially the Keurig machine since it has been responsible for house and office fires.  (Not sure which models are most at risk). In 2014 Keurig Recalled 6.6 Million K10 Mini's because of 90 burn complaints. When you unplug the new unit it loses its settings. The old B70 would keep it's brew settings after being unplugged. The new K575 has to be reprogrammed every time we plug it in. Keurig made $4.5 Billion in 2015. How greedy can you get not allowing third party Mom and Pop operations make K cups? The price of the unit was $135 which is a lot cheaper then the old B70 at the time. The Keurig K575 is the ink jet printer and the K-Cups are the ink cartridges. Keurig makes money on the K Cups not the machine. Their was a study done, K-Cup coffee costs roughly $50 per pound, while you can buy a 1 pound bag of Starbucks house coffee for $13 a pound or Dunkin Donuts in a 1 pound bag for $11!
review_title: Unit won't work with old licensed K-Cups!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Vincent Kamp
review_text: been wanting this coffee maker for some time and it has made my day don't have to waste coffee by making a full pot as it does one cup at a time the pods are a little high in price but cant have everything I realy love this coffee maker
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Arrived to my deployed location defective. It worked for one cup and that was it. Tried flushing it, cleaning everything, etc. Sent it back for a replacement but they still charged me and said they never received the old one. Since phones don't work so well in South East Asia and time zone differences limit call availability, i struggled to teach anyone to discuss short falls. Now that I'm back there is no number to call. Please help for a better rating!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Change Agent 007
review_text: Better than I expected.  I've had Keurig in the past.  This is my third one.  Number 1 I left in AR.  Number 2 died the morning that I ordered this one from Amazon.  Thanks to Prime, I only had to drink Tea two mornings before I received this wonderful Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Linda
review_text: I just bought this Keurig and will probably never purchase another one. This is the 3rd one that I bought after the 2nd one going bad in less than a year. But I thought I would try it again. I have already had problems with the water gathering at the K-cup and it has failed to heat twice. I am really planning on returning it. I don't know why you cannot just buy a product that works. Returning is such a hassle, which is why I was stuck with a machine that leaks. This is my last Keurig product. I have used a Ninja at work recently and will be switching to that.
review_title: This is the 3rd one that I bought after the 2nd one going bad in less than a year
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: c valles
review_text: Never been happier with a keurig than I am with this. My husband loves it too. The brew time is so much faster and shorter than the original classic version. And a lot more cup size options. I love that I can use a carafe or just a single cup. The water reservoir is about double the size of our old one. So we have to fill it less often. Love this coffee machine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Alex
review_text: This is not the first machine from Keurig. This one is excellent. It gives a lot of cup sizes, ability to brew stronger coffee, use carafe. It s simple to use and looks very stylish! I am happy with it!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: PrimeAddict
review_text: Best thing since sliced bread.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bill
review_text: Makes horrible noises when it refills.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: RLS
review_text: Love hate with this company. Let's try machine number 3, returning these things has been a daily  process...  Two machines returned in 6 days. Im using the right cups and it gets constant opps errors and leaks grounds everything.  First one didn't heat...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Peter Stillmank
review_text: I replaced an earlier 1.0 model wit this one. It takes longer to start to fill the cup than the old one. It also takes a sorted cup, so I can not use the one I have been using for years... boo. The water reservoir is bigger, so that helps. You can not just leave the lid up, so it drys out., like the previous model. If you do you have to close the lid on the K-cup and them reopen it and close it to get it to start. Strange. It has a "Stronger" button, but I have no idea what it does.It does do a 12 oz cup of coffee, which is nice, The 1.0 model would only do a 10 oz cup. I would rebuy this one for the 12oz option.
review_title: Not much of an upgrade over the 1.0 model
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Stephen W.
review_text: I am very disappointed with my Keurig 575. I really thought I was treating myself to the perfect coffee brewer. It was packaged well, instructions were adequate and a nice appearance. The reason for my poor rating is brewing temperature, 157 degrees, I enjoy sipping my coffee in the am not having to microwave it after just a few minutes.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Mrs. Dish
review_text: I love the new Keriug. It did take time to figure out how to use it. That is the case whenever you get something different. The looks of the machine is beautiful. Even my husband loves it. I think 3 things I really like is it is nice and hot, and the strength , also the size cup you can choose. All and all We love it. Strongly recommend this product.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Tom Myers
review_text: This has become a "team" brewer at work so we go through a lot more cycles than my K250 at home.  It seems to be holding up well, but like (apparently) all 2.0 brewers, it is a little inconsistent about recognizing 2.0 compatible cups.  It occassionally rejects even Green Mountain brand cups.  So far, reseating the cup has resolved the issue but K/Green Mountain made a huge mistake trying to restrict customers to their own brand of cups.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: T. Smith
review_text: I'm not yet having most of the problems mentioned in other reviews but I can't stop it from turning off every night. I disabled the auto turn-on and auto turn-off but ever night it turns off. So I tried enabling the auto turn off and set it to 1am and the auto on to 6am. It still turned off but did not turn on. I know it's a minor annoyance but I hate having to wait for it to heat the water every morning.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: James L McKay
review_text: This Keurig K575 Single Serve Coffee maker was purchase thru Amazon Prime earlier this year (2017).
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: woodman
review_text: What can I say. You get what u pay for.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: FRED von AMERONGEN
review_text: ABSOLUTELY, WITHOUT A DOUBT, THE VERY BEST COFFEE MACHINE I HAVE EVER PURCHASED.
review_title: THE VERY BEST COFFEE MACHINE I HAVE EVER PURCHASED
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Keurig has improved their sensor to the level that I can not get any products: reusable k-cups, clips, etc. to allow me to use my own brand of coffee.  In the spirit of let the buyer be ware I admit I was was fooled by Keurig.  At the same time I will not purchase a Keurig for myself, family members or friends as I refuse to have someone else dictate to me what coffee I should drink.  May sound harsh but I prefer to have control of what I do, say and in this case drink.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I bought this after my Cuisinart brand (made by Keurig ironically) stopped working-and I had it several years with no problems. I was impressed with the features and style of this brewer; it worked fine for a couple of months. Then the little annoyances began. Would stop brewing mid-cycle and need the needle flushed. Or it would brew a cup full of grounds. (We have the auto delivery plan from Keurig so all of the K cups we use are compatible.) Then it would request descaling only a few weeks since the last descaling treatment. It's a hit or miss every time we use this piece of junk and I'm getting tired of wasting K cups. I love the convenience and variety of single brew systems, but I'm not sure if I'll replace it once it finally goes out.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: MelG
review_text: Love this machine. I just wish Keurig would make their brewers taller for travel cups. I can get a few of our travel cups under it but not most. I do love that I can put in all the way under the cabinets and still open the top. No pulling it forward and pushing it back. Maybe that's why it's not taller? hmmm.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Comer1434
review_text: LOVE,  love the 80oz capacity. Make sure you buy the orange stickers or watch the YouTube video on how to make none K cup official cups works. This was a breeze to set up. Breeze to use. In my humble  opinion the k mugs aren't worth it. Happy caffeining
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Angie
review_text: Of Course two weeks after my return window.  My Keurig starts acting crazy.  I go through about 3 Kcups each morning (which are expensive) to get a cup of coffee without a cup full of coffee grounds.  I have basically bought an expensive tea pot.  I only use it now for the hot water option.... I'm not happy at all.  At my store I bought a cheaper Keurig machine and it works perfect.  So its not the user its the product.
review_title: Of course two weeks after my return window it doesn't work right at all.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: oakleytiger
review_text: Product was defective and appeared to have been opened and returned. I have ordered a replacement and I will update my review when it arrives.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Texas Gurl
review_text: Huge mistake on my part.  I loved the features but the K575 is unreliable.  I.'performing  needle maintenance every day.  I must run water through it before using a K.-Cup since grounds from the K-Cup clog the needle.  Anyone have a recommendation as a replacement?
review_title: I loved the features but the K575 is unreliable
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jody
review_text: Item looked like it was used and repackaged when I received it. Disappointed, it will be going back!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Karen Shepherd
review_text: If I could change anything about this Keurig K575 , It would be a setting for light , medium. I find the K-cups really put out some strong coffee. I purchased a filter to add my on coffee and maybe I could tweak my amount in the K- Cup. I like my coffee strong don t get me wrong; but it s strong . Overall the rest of this Keurig is a great coffee maker and I m truly enjoying it .
review_title: Great Coffee and strong to the last drop .
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Sharon
review_text: Love my Keurig it's kind of like my best friend in the mornings.  I plugged my older model into a power source during Hurricane Irma and it killed my Keurig so I needed a new one.  This one is newer and beautiful on my counter.  Very easy to operate and my mom who suffers from a brain injury and finds it hard to adapt and learn new things was able to pick it up quickly.  Highly recommended.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Tom Combs
review_text: This Keurig is very noisy.  We called customer service and face-timed brewing a cup with the customer service person.  She said that was not right, sent us a new one, but it is just as bad.  Much louder than the 400 model we had before.  Plus, it takes longer to brew a cup --  over a minute.  And, in just a few days we have had 4 times when there were grounds in the coffee from a busted pod.  It has to be something wrong with how the needle engages or, the pods are defective.  they are Kuerig pods that we ordered direct.  Finally, the water compartment is much more difficult to fill, it is bigger than on the 400 series but it requires filling when there is still a lot of water left in the reservoir so, it actually has to be filled more often and it is clumsy to get on and off.  Overall, I strongly do not recommend this coffee brewing machine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: KatBelew
review_text: Keurig K575 Single Serve Programmable K-Cup Server works fine but I can't use my tall cups to brew.  It is made for short cups only.  I have to brew in small cup and pour into my tall cup that has a lid.
review_title: Try to get one that holds taller cups.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: NAME_NOT_RETURNED
review_text: I had the Keurig 2.0 for three years until it gave up the ghost and needed to be replaced.  This one is MUCH louder than the 2.0, takes longer to brew, and the coffee doesn't taste as good.  One the positive side, the choice of regular or strong brew strength is very nice to have.  All in all, I'm glad I have it; it's just disappointing that the newer, more expensive model isn't as good as the brilliantly-made previous model.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: My husband and I decided to get this keurig coffee maker because of the options it offered. I do no drink coffee but I love capucino's, hot cocoa and teas. My husband is a huge coffee drinker so he was the only one who used our regular old coffee maker. I love the options on this particular machine with temp control, led screen etc. and it looks very sleek. I would definitely recommend this product. The only thing I will say bad was that it showed up with scratches and scuffs near the panel of the LED screen. However the machine still works properly.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jerry B.
review_text: Noisy takes too long. Not at all what I expected and I returned it.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: andrea
review_text: Clogs a lot more than my previous Keurig, does not accommodate many of the k-cup I like to use.
review_title: Not as good as the original!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: JohnWR
review_text: This is a good second runner up to our top of the line Keurig which stopped working. This is really easy to program as well. It does not hold as much water as our other one did. We now only use distilled water as regular tap water is what destroyed our other one, even with the extra filters we put in it. I highly recommend this  one
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: HannahLace
review_text: I ve seen m a few bad reviews on this model but I bought it anyways. It works perfectly. Anytime something with amazon doesn t work, they ship a working item right out so I knew it wouldn t be an issue regardless. I love my Keurig :)
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Axxman
review_text: this replaced a 6 year old k75, wow what an improvement. the timer the filter and the ability to control the size and strength of coffee. Also the ability to fill a Caraf. this one is much improved over my old one.
review_title: this replaced a 6 year old k75, wow what ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Billie Thomas
review_text: It explodes the pods, and when I called Keurig they were no help. Not only will no one let me return a 3 month old machine that doesn't work, they were super sassy on the phone.
review_title: they were super sassy on the phone
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Archaeogirl1996
review_text: With the exception of the on/off button on the LCD screen not working, I love the machine. I gave it four stars only because I have to keep unplugging it, and this may cause a short in the wire.It's so nice not having to wait so long for the cup the brew. Of course, you have to wait for the preheating cycle, but other than that, it works fast.
review_title: Love my machine, but the on/off button doesn't work
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Takuro Spirit
review_text: Not sure why others complain about it not getting hot enough.... y'all must have calluses in your mouths. I temped the water using a digital meat thermometer right after it finished brewing on its hottest setting and got 177 degrees. Hot enough for me to not be able to drink it right away, and in a proper cup it stays hot enough for me several hours later.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ellen
review_text: I have really enjoyed this  new Keurig.  Works great and totally fills the purpose for which it was bought.  I only wish the water tank was larger.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: IamME
review_text: Maybe a little premature. But i am loving my new Keurig, I was afraid at all the "not compatible" reviews so far i have run thru a ton of different k-cups from all over, From $$ markets to the dollar store brand and it doesn't fail or has yet to give me the "not compatible" error.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ben L.
review_text: I ve used it nearly everyday for the past 3 months and i haven t had a single issue. The machine warms up in under a minute and will be pouring out the coffee in less than 3 minutes. I only wish there was a model with a sturdier base made out of composites; the cheap plastic exterior causes me to tuck this off in the corner so it doesn t cross my line of sight unless I m actively using it
review_title: Great mechanics, cheap bargain bin design and construction
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I've had 4 other Kuerig brewers in the past but it's been a few years so my husband gifted me this top of the line Keurig. Everything has a weird plastic taste-even after repeated washing of water reservoir and flushing the machine.  The coffee even appears weak compared to the older style machine.  Very disappointed.
review_title: Not the quality you expect from Keurig
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Rocky X TV
review_text: I bought this for my wife nearly a year ago and it's still working great! It gets used everyday and the only downfalls would be the price of some K-cups and that some pods are not compatible with this machine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Yawwee
review_text: First off - please ignore the used-mug water. WILL NOT ACCEPT refill cups that are not specifically designed for the Keurig 2.0. LOTS of restrictions - If you are looking for WinXP/Vista, this is more like Win8.1/Win10 in user-friendliness and customization. They put a IR-reader image sensor in that reads the cup lids - if you find it annoying, fix it by watching a video (before buying to determine if you are capable) - its as easy as following the wires and pulling a certain plug.
review_title: ------DETAILED TECHNICAL REVIEW------- You should probably read this if you are considering purchasing one.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Nathan L. Hill
review_text: Best Keurig ever purchased
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: GregoryAT
review_text: We love this thing. My wife likes somewhat weak coffee and i make very strong coffee and hot water with it. Great product Keurig! I did get the extened warranty with it, but I have no idea how to use it since we never received any instructions on how to use it (if needed).
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Raymond E. Theiss
review_text: The machine brews great coffee - when it brews !!!!  This machine requires VERY FREQUENT maintenance in the form of cleaning.  I can brew 10 - 15 cups and then I have to undergo the cleaning procedure.  It's a royal pain in the ass.
review_title: The machine brews great coffee - when it brews
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Cat SA
review_text: This is our 2nd Keurig. Old one still works. You can't go wrong with it. We have ours hooked up to our faucet. Never have to worry about keeping the water filled. Love It!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Gitane56
review_text: We just love this thing. Makes the best coffee and keeps caring for it a breeze. It tells you when to do what. Highly recommend! As a matter of fact, I bought this one because my daughter-in-law has one!! My other daughter-in-law bought one after having coffe with ouyr new one!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: KM
review_text: Excellent coffee maker.  The only thing I don't like is that the water asks to be filled with a lot of water still in it.  Otherwise, we have cleaned it a few times ad it goes back to working great.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Renee
review_text: It has made a funny sound right out of the box.  but we love our Keurig and use it everyday several times a day.  people do ask why does it make that sound (mine doesnt) i just say, "Hows your coffee"  with a smile :)
review_title: It has made a funny sound right out of the box
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Kristy L Sommers
review_text: I have seriously enjoyed my new Keurig this is my third Keurig pot very high class quality cup of coffee I like how this one works much better than my past two and I like that it has a bigger tank and it's very classy looking... Plus I have so many other options of doing different size cups and a karaf
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Wade H.
review_text: ****  Warning ****
review_title: Warranty replacements result in K-Elite brewer being sent.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bill From RI
review_text: I've had this unit for less than 4 months and all of a sudden it began failing every time I go to brew a cup.
review_title: Keurig brewers very solid, reliable, I love them but this ONE unit may have a bug?
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: B. Jacobs
review_text: Great machine - works well but missing a few parts when shipped. Disappointing that they are lacking in quality control -
review_title: Missing parts and very slow to brew
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Justin
review_text: Works well like most reviewers say. The only issue I had was running well water through it (which was softened). Apparently the ions in water softener salt bond with coffee grounds, plugging up the K-cups and throwing an error message. We started using distilled water you buy at the store in one gallon containers and haven't had any issues since then.
review_title: Works well like most reviewers say
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Randy
review_text: Will buy again
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: RockOperaRat
review_text: Pros: My first Keurig.  I Like the digital display and the light color options and my family loves it.  The hot water dispenser for all else in these Chicagoland winters is nice.  Lots of temp and size variables for those who want to do something different.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: David Luke
review_text: The unit works well with some pods, but others burst out the top and spew grounds into the coffee and everywhere.  Never had this problem with my other keurigs.  I have tried everything that is on their website to remedy the problem, but no change.  The particular coffees are the donunt house blend, which they send as a sample and krispy kreme donut blend.  I purchased this model so I could make 12oz cups of coffee, without a bunch of grounds in my coffee.
review_title: The unit works well with some pods, but others ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Mom of 3
review_text: Purchased just over a month ago and receive frequent error issues.  Have to clean the needle frequently to reset.  Disappointed in this product considering the price.  Had an older version that had no extras and it worked well for about 4 years.
review_title: The bells and whistles are not worth the headaches!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: .Bad.Wolf.
review_text: When it's working, I absolutely love it. But I get the "needle maintenance" screen a couple times a day & the "needle maintenance" doesn't always work. I've only had it for a month.
review_title: I just want to drink my coffee without a fuss.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Don B
review_text: Great coffee maker!! We replaced our old Keurig with K575 2,0. What a difference a few years make. It's like coming out of the stone age (The Flint Stones). There are so many features I wouldn't know where to start. One thing for sure it makes a great cup of coffee whether you use the pods or purchase filter cup from your local big box store.As always great delivery from Amazon Prime. Kudos!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: C. D. Cornett
review_text: 2nd one of these purchased and really enjoy the bells and and whistles.  1st one quit after several years but this one works better in that it takes all Keurig coffee pods, both regular and Keurig 2 pods.  Tells you when to change the filter, has a larger reservoir and does almost everything for you in the morning.  It's one of the most expensive Keurigs, but it's worth if you use it everyday.
review_title: 2nd one of these purchased and really enjoy the bells and and whistles
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: AL
review_text: This was a huge upgrade from out Black and Decker coffee maker. Kind of like getting a new phone, we had to read quite a bit on how to assemble, operate, clean, and troubleshoot it. But in no time we were able to figure it out and make our first cup.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Tyann Woodall
review_text: This is the best Keurig k cup machine ever!!! It has so many extra features.  I like I can set the temp of my coffee. It has a warm up setting before I get out of bed.  The best feature is the nightlight. I don t have to turn on bright kitchen light. A person can choose a different colors on the night light.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: C. Leonard
review_text: I really like this except I did not realize when purchasing this that many k-cups would not work with it.  Quite disappointing that Keurig has pulled this stunt by limiting what pods we can successfully use with their devices.
review_title: I like it but... k-cups usage is limited.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jill
review_text: I am not even sure if this is a common problem with the machine, but it makes a clunking sound when preparing the cup of coffee. We ve had other Keurig machines and never had this problem. We like the unit itself and decided to keep it, however, it s noisy and I haven t been able to determine by any other reviews if this is common or not.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Nikki
review_text: Due to breaking my wrist, it s taken a while to open this up and use it. Finally did this weekend and it looked like the box was opened previously. Wondering if it was a previous return?  Machine looked new so we set it up and it works fine. The box and amazon advertised that it came with a starter kit of coffee s to try. Those were missing from the box which is probably why we noticed it had been opened already. Not a huge deal to me as I have coffee but don t advertise that it s included if it won t be.
review_title: Finally did this weekend and it looked like the box was opened previously
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Derek H.
review_text: Very pleased with the K575.  There are lots of settings for multiple users and multiple types and sizes of K-cups.  Never noticed the warm up period when using unit prior to purchasing my own.  Unit indicates "more water" when reservoir falls just below half full !  Overall I like the convenience and novelty.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: L.T.
review_text: I moved my old Keurig and brought the "new model" for the main living area.  Not impressed...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Squirrel Monkey
review_text: I bought this 5 months ago, and I'm still very happy with it.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Universal Touch
review_text: I love the capability to do cups or carafe.  Works as well as my previous basic Keurig model with more options.
review_title: I love the capability to do cups or carafe

name: tmp585
review_text: I have purchased two previous Keurig brewers.  Both were excellent and brewed good/very good cups of coffee.  However, something has changed with Keurig's manufacturing process.  From the beginning, even after cleaning and running several reservoirs of water through the my new machine, there was a constant "plastic" odor to the brewed coffee which also affected taste.  It wasn't just me who noticed this problem.  Unsolicited , other individuals commented upon there sense that something didn't smell or taste right.  No matter what steps were taken to "clean" the machine, the odor returned and permeated both the smell and taste of the coffee.  I can only assume that Keurig has changed its production specifications and quality control.  If you research the issue online, you will see that many people have experienced the same problem.  Regardless of price, this issue is completely unacceptable and likely a health concern.  I have only written one other negative review of a product over the many years I have purchased items from Amazon.  i would caution anyone who is going to purchase a Keurig to be aware of this problem.
review_title: Plastic Odor and Taste Affecting Brewed Coffee
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Robert L.
review_text: The carafe technology on this unit has not been perfected. It should not have been marketed or offered for sale. About 75% of the time the carafe feature results in an error message and does not produce a pot of coffee. I called customer service...they told me to perform the "bulb" of water maintenance procedure (a pod with a bulb that you add water to and then pump the handle up and down 5 times supposedly clears out a clogged needle). I did that, and the carafe worked the next time...but failed again the second time. I think the problem is the design of the carafe pods, which pokes TWO holes in the top of the pod. Yes, customer service gave me a coupon for 8 free carafe edpods, but what good is that when the technology doesn't work? So I'm stuck using this with only the individual pods. UPDATE: Called Customer Service again...talked at length with a woman who was EMPHATIC that the carafe pods should have a hole punctured in the BOTTOM in addition to the two holes in the top. I argued at length with her that a hole in bottom was mechanically impossible with this unit...but she told me, "Sir, I've been with the company since it started and I know what I'm talking about." I asked to speak to her supervisor, who immediately told me there was NO HOLE punctured in the bottom. What a nightmare this whole product/experience has been. The supervisor blames the poor success rate on a bad batch of pods...there are sending me 2 free boxes. We'll see what happens. UPDATE: got boxes direct from Keurig, first carafe pod resulted in ERROR message and incomplete pot of coffee. I'm batting 50% success rate with carafe pods. This unit is either a lemon or the technology is not perfected.UPDATE one month later: called to complain again and was almost sent a new unit, but the man asked what kind of water I used...told him I had Culligan water softener water (which a previous Customer Service rep had said was OK). He said it was NOT OK...neither is distilled water. It MUST be "spring" water, otherwise the water "expands" the filter in the pod and causes problems. So I dumped the filtered water and ran several cycles of hot water to clean out any old water... used my unfiltered well water... and got TWO full carafes to run correctly. So I'm hopeful that solves the problem.
review_title: Unit is either a LEMON or technology is not perfected. UPDATE: problem solved
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: K2GQ
review_text: I'm giving this 4 stars only because it's so frickin' loud.. it sounds like a jet getting ready to take off when the warmer kicks on and then, as it's dispensing it makes a weird, strained squirting noise that gives one the impression that it's constipated. I don't recall the older Keurig machines being so noisy, however, it does reliably brew all the various pods and the presets are very handy when you typically use the same settings. Also, it will heat water for tea/cocoa/oatmeal faster than the electric kettle, so there is that. Have had it several months and thus far no complaints aside from the fact that it can wake you can hear it across the house when it turns itself on to heat water ahead of your first anticipated cup.

name: sctin1
review_text: I held out for as long as I could, thinking that the Keurig fad was just that.  My son, who served in the Marine Corps and is now a firefighter has had his share of (strong) coffee and when he told me had loved his Keurig, it raised an eyebrow. Finally when my old coffee maker starting to fail, I decided it was time.  I really must say, this machine is pretty great! The K-cups and K-carafe pods are expensive (in my book), but super convenient. I'm somewhat of a cheapskate, so I bought the large and small K pods so I could use my own coffee (I still had a whole bag). It has taken some trial and error to get it all just right, but I love my coffee and that's the bottom line. I use the K-cups for a quick cup in the evening, but use the large pod with my own coffee in the morning to make a whole pot of strong coffee - just the way I like it! Even my wife, who does not drink coffee, enjoys the chai tea k-cups. Bonus!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Stephen Davis
review_text: First off, I'm not a coffee snob. So far this thing works great, and I have no complaints after 1 month. name: Barnacle Bill The Sailor
review_text: Our 11 year old Keurig home brewer wasn't dead but it was dying.  No complaints, that coffee maker saw plenty of use.  So I just purchased this top of the current Keurig home line without much thought.  They have come a long way in the past decade.  But it still performs the same basic function of turning out a good cup of coffee quickly.  And still looks basically the same.  The different brew sizes are something I've wanted for years.  An increased reservoir from 60 to 80 oz of water is welcome.  And the touchscreen is well implemented with easy to use customizing options.  It's also both quieter than the old pump system and the noise it does make is different, less annoying.  Also, Keurig has added a water filter to the reservoir and provided a tool to clean the needle that punctures the K-cups.  The machine also reminds you to descale (clean) it periodically.  So it looks like Keurig has put some thought into maintenance and longevity which is appreciated.  And the coffee?  Great as always.  We don't use the disposable K-cups generally.  It's far cheaper to use the reusable K-cups and your favorite coffee.  You'll break even on the price of the reusable K-cups in a single week.
review_title: A new replacement for our 11 year old Keurig with a lot of welcome improvements.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

review_text: Better than my last Keurig. Some advice though I know from a close relative and a close friend they did Not use filtered water or bottled water and used tap water daily. 18-24 months later their machines stopped working in a couple different area's of their with irreparable calcium and filth clogging. They tried flushing their machines with bleach water 4/5 times to no avail. I had my last Keurig for 6 years and just wanted a new K575. My old one still works fine. Why? Because I learned from their cheapness to take care of my machine by only using filtered or bottled water. Period.

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I've had nothing but trouble with this coffee maker.  I've only had it for 6 months & have had issues for about 3-4 of those months.  I love the convenience of making k-cups but have had issues with the coffee maker.  I'm been getting an error message saying "Water under pressure, slowly open handle.  Perform needle maintenance."  We've had to do this probably 20 times in the last month not to mention, we've watched videos to see other ways (vinegar) to do the needle maintenance.  I paid too much for this Keurig K575 to have to deal with doing needle maintenance almost every day now.  It will make one cup fine & then the next cup says "Sorry, brew interrupted"  I thought it was a box of pods I had purchased at Costco (that I'd been using for years) & took them back.  Then I ordered a variety pack of K-cup Keurig pods & had the same issues.  I plan to also call Keurig & see what they have to say about this model.  I've used Keurig coffee makers for years & have never had this type of problem.  Unhappy Keurig customer for sure.  :((
review_title: I love the convenience of making k-cups but have had issues ...

name: Jeanette Asbury
review_text: I will update this review as needed, but right now I am just plain frustrated.  Merry Christmas, Happy New Year and what is the one thing you want on a long holiday weekend when it's only 12  out?  Yup... Coffee from our just delivered K575 bought with Christmas money.  My usually non-coffee drinking husband had the idea to get one.  I had been wanting one for years.  Imagine our excitement.  I set it up AFTER fully reading the instructions.  Ran the 1st water only 8oz. cup through.  Then I settled in to relax for the day with a 10oz. cup of one of the samplers included in the box.  Brilliant!  Worked great!  A bit later I realized I had forgotten to discard the empty pod.  I threw it out, lowered the lever and cooked dinner; oblivious that the error message came on.  "Water pressure....Use maintenance assembly...clean needles...".  Ran through all that using the instruction manual.  Nothing.  It won't even clear the message so you can run a water cycle through.  Hit the YouTube videos.  Nothing.  Have you ever called support during the holiday?  Don't bother.  They are closed.  It looks like mine lasted 1 cup.  I intend to call them tomorrow and probably exchange this one in hopes that a second one is part of the excellent 5 star batch.  I know many people that love them and have no issues.  Few known to hate them.
review_title: Happy New Year and what is the one thing you ...

review_text: Just not worth it.  Way cheaper to use a normal coffee maker.  The time savings is a silly argument.  Unless you keep it on all the time you are still only saving a couple minutes from brewing a pot in a normal coffee maker.  The coffee budget quadrupled between all the prepackaged pods and filling the custom ones.  If you try to fill your own pod you wind up using more coffee grinds since the grind can't be too fine otherwise you get sediment in your cup.  MONEY PIT.

review_text: This unit replaced my older Keurig Coffee maker. Functionally the Coffee Maker is great. The main issue with the unit is the overwhelmingly pungent Plastic Taste. I have washed the unit multiple times since receiving it and run it through 20 hot water cycles to include flushing it with white vinegar. I have soaked various parts including the water reservoir overnight in warm water, but the plastic taste remains. You cannot leave any standing water in the unit or reservoir overnight. Part of the morning coffee routine includes 4 hot water cycles to flush the unit. Very disappointing the Keurig would use such cheap plastic components!

review_text: We love keurigs but this most recent design is flawed. A bunch of our name brand coffee that Keurig sells didn't even work in this machine. Thankfully we found solo clip 2.0 to use with this Keurig so we could use the many boxes of k cups we had already purchased. I don't appreciate Keurig trying to screw over their customers by making us unable to use coffee we had already purchased. I wrote Keurig about the issue since there was a sheet inside the new Keurig box that said they would replace any k cups you had that did not work. They replied with a generic email twice and never replaced anything. Very disappointed in them.

name: DR
review_text: I purchased this coffee maker after our previous Keurig essentially wore out after years of use. I read a number of the many reviews good and bad and decided it was worth the risk to purchase this brewer. Setup was easy, the coffee maker looks gorgeous. The illuminated reservoir is a nice touch. I followed all the setup instructions and finally brewed my first cup of coffee. It was, as expected, great. Yesterday morning, my wife and I are looking forward to cup so I brew two cups. I brewed her cup first, mine immediately after. Her cup tasted great, mine tasted so chemical/plastic tasting it was overwhelming. This morning, I try it again. I brew mine first and hers second. Mine tastes great, hers is the plastic/chemical issue. I let the coffee maker cool and brew just two cups of water back to back. I call my wife in and let her just smell the water. She was easily able to identify which cup was brewed second and had the chemical characteristics from just the odor.
