name: K.D.
review_text: I was truly impressed with the authentic flavor of the Starbucks cups since I am very familiar with what Starbucks coffee should taste like. Spot on!. Ok, had to say that first, because there was a single issue that I have experienced with this machine, but it does not in my opinion diminish the experience I am having. When I first turned on the machine, there was a pixelated bar across the touchscreen that distorted the graphics and text. It made it hard to read. Now I work in an industry that manufactures industrial networking devices and I am very aware that these kinds of things happen from time to time in the real world. I simply went to my Amazon order history and chose to return the product as defective and to request a replacement. Amazon shipped out another unit the same day and I gave me 30 days to return the original product. They even arranged for shipping. As I said, this does not reflect poorly on the device in my opinion since it could have happened from being mishandled as well as any other occurrence. Amazon's method of handling this issue has more than made up for any inconvenience of having to wait 2 more days to enjoy this Coffee Maker. Kudos Amazon for brilliant customer service. Oh, and if you are looking for a good Coffee Maker, this is the one.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: DANNY M
review_text: My original Keurig machine broke after about 5 years and we purchased this unit. This is a big improvement over my original unit. You can use different types of Keurig cups with this unit, and it even can use the bigger Karafe cups without having to change anything on the machine. The company came up with an expending opening, (spring loaded) that allows you to insert the bigger Keurig cups without changing anything on the machine. A very nice option when you need to make larger amounts of coffee when entertaining. The display is all touch screen digital, including the on and off for the machine. The menu is very easy to use and has more options that the original machine. The machine is more advanced that the original and seems to work flawlessly.

name: Priscilla H.
review_text: Ran 4 cups through it to clean it.  Worked fine.  Put in a K-cup and it swelled the cup up and blew grounds into the mug followed by the clean needle message,  Removed everything and cleaned the needle and the k-cup holder.  Ran another cup of plain water through, no problem.  Put in another k-cup and swelled it up again and blew grounds into my coffee again.  All k-cups are Keurig brand.  Cleaned everything again.  Finally got a full cup of coffee on my 3rd try without grounds or the message.  Followed by another good cup.  Next morning swelled the first and second k-cups again and a cup full of coffee grounds.  After screwing with it again for 20 minutes I finally got a good cup.  Took 7k-cups to get 3 cups of coffee, 4 wasted...
review_title: Sorry, Brew Interrupted...  Wasting K-cups everytime I use it.  Waste of money and waste of time.

name: Ian D Ghrist
review_text: I bought this for a 4-person office. We do not have a sink in the office. We have to use the community sink down the hall, so I wanted a simple coffee maker that we could use by filling it with bottled water. Going with the Keurig 2.0 was a disaster. It stopped working after brewing about 5 cups of coffee. It just displayed an error message saying something about there being a problem with the water pressure. I called Keurig tech support and I was told that this model has higher maintenance requirements than the regular model and you have to use the enclosed maintenance kit on the unit once a week. The support person walked me through the process of using the kit, which requires multiple hot water pours (highly inconvenient given that I have to walk all the way down the hall to the community sink to dump the water and the whole point of buying a Keurig machine instead of a regular coffee maker was to avoid this). After performing the maintenance, the machine worked fine. I also found out that the Keurig 2.0 reads your K-Cups and gives you an error message if you try to use a non-Keurig cup, which also forces you to go through the maintenance steps to get the machine working again. I do not think I could possibly be less happy with this piece of junk. I hope I can get a refund and go back to the Keurig 1.0, which worked fine for me in my old office for several years without problems. Buy the 2.0 models at your own risk. They break a lot, require constant maintenance, and are designed to break when non-Keurig cups are used. If you buy one, then get ready to either spend a lot of time on the phone with Keurig's tech support or spend a lot of time reading the manual to figure out how to fix it when it breaks.
review_title: the machine worked fine. I also found out that the Keurig 2

review_text: I've had the K575 for 3 months now and everything seems to be working fine. I did have a concern about 2.0 compatibility but I have now realized that any brand worth drinking works on this Keurig machine just fine. You can make 6oz, 8oz, 10oz, and 12oz cups with a regular k-cup and with bottled/filtered/distilled and a good brand coffee they all taste good. The K575 has a strong setting also that I have used on some of the weaker k-cups.

name: Alan
review_text: Of the many different models of Keurigs, This is probably the best in my mind. It doesn't fool around with electronic wizardry, and will accept off brand coffee pods unlike the newer models. It's also tall enough to accept a travel mug, if you lift out the drip tray. I've run some white vinegar through it twice in that many years to remove lime deposits. I keep it on 24/7, but it's programmable for time on/off if you like. This one won't take the carafe, which only means that everyone gets fresh coffee.

I ran through the set up instructions just as I did for all of my previous machines.  The smell and taste of plastic is overwhelming.  Now that I see other reviews stating the same I think it's irresponsible to continue selling this.  I've tried everything from repeatedly cleaning and descaling the machine to running all of the samples and more to get rid of the plastic smell and taste.  Nothing worked.  I'm done with Keurig after this.

review_text: This thing is garbage. I wasn't able to brew a single cup with it. It failed right out of the box, giving me some aggravating failure message. Perhaps Keurig's business model doesn't involve actually selling working brewing machines, perhaps the whole point is redistributing industrial waste, because that's what this piece of garbage is, expensive waste.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Denise Lackey
review_text: I had my previous Keurig for about 5 years and it was a workhorse.  It finally wore out and wouldn't hold the water pressure needed to brew.  It just pumped the water right back into the reservoir.  So I wanted another Keurig and got this one.  It's just OK.  It is noisy, slower (when using the Strong setting), and cheaply made.  AND it waits until you have your coffee pod in the machine and hit the brew button to let you know to add water.  Very annoying.  The "horse shoe" shaped silver trim on top is loose and won't stay down flush with the top of the machine as it should.  I suppose some gorilla glue will take care of it.  Too much trouble and expensive to send it back.  I had to use the new "bubble" after the first few days to clear out the needle.  This one came with the extra "bubble" part.  (You'll see when you get the  machine.)  When this one kicks the bucket (which I feel will be much sooner than 5 years like the previous machine), I will consider one of the other brand brewers on the market.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Linda McCoy
review_text: Hopefully, the one I got is defective and not a total product defect.  Received the product in July of 2017.  Four months later a number of things have happened.  On at least 5 occasions the system would freeze up.  The only way to get it working again is to unplug the unit, wait for about 15 seconds and plug it back in.  For the moment that seems to correct the situation.  One one occasion, the water level indicator stopped functioning and had to quickly get water into the reservoir as it was empty and sucking air into the system.  More common is after brewing a cup of coffee, the "K" appears saying the coffee is ready and never goes back to the "home" state
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Gordon Thomson
review_text: I previously rated this with one star after many messy K-Cup failures. With help from Keurig, it was concluded that our houses's softened tap water was causing K-Cup contents to clump with consequent bursting under pressure. For the last week, we have been using bottled water from the local store, and have not had any failures. The machine is now working well and we are pleased with the quality of both coffee and tea. As a coffee maker, I would give it five stars, but I take one off for the inconvenience of having to buy bottled water to use it.
review_title: Had messy failures but now using bottled water
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: saf4amazon
review_text: My wife uses this as I quit drinking coffee. Overall this maker is good. Main flaw is that the speacial little suction/blower tool needs to be used about every 10 cups of coffee or so to clean out the drip maker or whatever you call it. Either way the maintenance is required which is a pain in the bottom, but the wife can do it so it cant be that hard, lol. Everything else about this machine works as it should and no problems. The night light is really cool and blue or green maybe red too cant remember but its good. The touch screen and programming and setup is nice and easy yet robust. This machine does come with a water filter already so you dont need to buy one in order to get started. In fact my unit came with everything, even coffee, so I didnt need to buy anything extra at first....but of course I did because the items were not listed clear enough in the description. Anyway, this review is probably old already the way technology changes so fast, but if not, then enjoy.

review_text: I bought this as an upgrade from the basic model for options such as stronger brew and the ability to have a carafe when my old machine gave out. It's fine for those items, but I'm very disappointed that it takes so much longer to warm up both initially and between cups than the old machine. At this price point it should be faster than the old machine, not slower. It also takes much longer to finish brewing, the last few drops to come out are agonizingly slow and if you're using a tall cup you can't take it out and just let them go into the tray or they will splash onto your counter and have to be wiped off. I would not buy this model again.

name: down2xroads
review_text: This particular model is the coffee maker and filter system only.  The pictures show the carafe and text talks about a carafe and mug size pods, but it never mentions that the carafe is not included with this model.  My previous k-cup coffee maker was a Cuisinart model SS700, so I'm spoiled as to how one of these should work.  This model makes considerably more pump noise and it delivers the coffee in pulsed, spurt-like streams rather than in a continuous quiet stream like the Cuisinart would.  It takes a few days to get used to it.  The energy saving mode means that it has to heat the water before it will dispense, so you have to wait a couple more minutes in the morning after waking it up for it to be ready to make coffee.  It does a very good job of making coffee.  Unlike my SS700, it actually dispenses an 8 or 10 oz cup and the option to make it stronger is very useful.  My only complaint has to do with the cup support tray.  It does not connect solidly to the coffee maker and slides out of position quite easily.  If you also want the carafe and some K-carafe pods, you should purchase model K550 or K560, both of which often sell for less than the K575.  Go figure...
review_title: Coffee maker and filter only.  No Carafe.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

review_text: DONOT BUY THIS MACHINE.  This product is basically an overpriced piece of junk.  I've bought two of these over the past 2 years and they both have stopped working.  The first one stopped after about 15 months and the second after 3 months.  I've maintained them according to the maintenance instructions but both developed the well known problem of "Water Under Pressure" error, which prevents the machine from working.  I've tried performing the recommended needle maintenance, which works one or two times and then stops working altogether, leaving me with another worthless piece of Keurig junk.  Descaling does not solve the problem either.  There must be a defective sensor in these machines, or the needle maintenance is a temporary, short term fix before your machine is about to crap out.

name: Hailee
review_text: This was so disappointing. If my kid made a product this bad, they would be grounded for a year. I bought this to replace an older Keurig. I do not recommend, the new Keurig systems are horrible, this was the third system I have tried in the past three months (K55, 425s and this). They start including a self cleaning tool because they clog up so much. Any medal items they have replace with cheap plastic and the whole system seems flimsy. If you are wanting to try a Keurig system, wait until a new line comes out. There were great features on this machine. I am not a coffee drinker (My spouse is) and the coffee features work great, until it clogs up. It clogs up about every fourth cup. I called support a couple of times and they tell you to use the cleaning tool and run hot water. It takes about 18oz of hot water to clear the system out before restarting it, you have to do it after every fourth cup of coffee. I like using the hot water for tea and oatmeal, but you have to have at least 18 oz of water filtered first. This is a picture of the Keurig with 10 oz of water run through it. The old system was so much better. If I could go back in time and purchase two or three of those systems I would. If you have trying to buy a new Keurig. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
review_title: Horrible, older models are 10 times better
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bryan C.
review_text: I am reviewing the Keurig 2.0 Model K575 coffee brewing system. Before I begin, I just want to say in advance, " Thanks, Keurig and Influenster, I received this free product for my unbiased review. My wife and I really love this machine and the single cup concept.  I did no know anything about the 2.0 system, Naturally not knowing anything about the 2.0, I began to research it and read the reviews. To be quite honest, I was initially very upset that I was supposedly getting an "upgraded" machine in which my K -cups I had might not work. I was reading reviews and feeling the same as all of those frustrated with this news UNTIL I realized that there are VERY FEW K Cups that may not work in this machine. I realized that all the bad reviews were coming from people who buy the cheap off-brand or no-name version of a K-cup that some stores sell to use in this machine to try and save money. I don't blame Keurig one bit for trying to keep others from riding on their coat tails by trying to make money off of someone else's hard work. I have no connection with Keurig. To be honest with you, I'm not in the business world at all. I'm a firefighter who happens to like a good cup of coffee from a company with quality customer service. The new Keurig 2.0 is a great machine despite all the bad ratings it gets. The bad reviews are only based on the customers anger which should not be used to rate the quality and function of this machine. It brews a great cup of coffee or you can even brew a carafe for a larger group. Every K -cup we own works in this system. It has a larger water reservoir, so it doesn't have to be filled as often. It also has a touch screen with more choices in the size of the cup of coffee you may want. Don't let the reviews about the K-cups sway your decision about purchasing this unit. It's a great coffee Machine. You won't be disappointed.
review_title: Excellent machine that makes a tasty cup of coffee and tea!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

review_text: This supposed coffee maker has given us nothing but frustration! If you want to spend half a morning pandering and trouble shooting just for a simple cup of joe then this is perfect! It comes up with error after error despite all 'needle maintenance' 'dispensing hot water' and other commands it gives being performed numerous times to absolutely no prevail. If it starts a brew it stops after a few seconds and claims "brew interrupted" it constantly displays a pathetic "oops" message even though we use the keurig k cup pods! I really hate this machine. It was not cheap and it just refuses to work. It would honestly be easier to drive to a coffee house each morning than struggling with this thing. It did work for a few months then wham! Just gives excuse after excuse that it needs this or that done to it. I clean it thoroughly, perform all the requests it has etc.  It's basically an expensive hole puncher (ruining pods without ever providing coffee). Just a horrible experience from a very shoddy company!

name: Amazon Woman
review_text: The fancier they get the more temperamental they are.  I bought the K575 after owning the K55 thinking I wanted the larger reservoir so I didn't have to fill it so often as I drink a lot of coffee.  Here's what I have found with the KR575.  It takes longer to heat up to get a cup of coffee than the K55 and since I'm not doing anything while I'm waiting for it to heat up, I find myself refilling it just as much as I did the K55, out of boredom from waiting.  It is nosier while making a cup, this doesn't bother me though.  We like the coffees that have cream in them.  This demands that the machine be cleaned more often than it did with the K55.  We got the machine on November 9th and I discovered it needed cleaned before Thanksgiving.  I used the piece they give you to clean it but it didn't because the problem was not coffee grounds clogging the needles but the cream from the coffees had gunked it up and I had to take it apart and clean it.  There are three removable pieces that need cleaned and the stationary part that they fit into.
review_title: K55 is better and here's why
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Sharon Parker
review_text: I've used another model of Keurig for over 4 years and loved it. When it started having problems I got rid of it and got the 2.0 575 Plus. Wow....I wish I had my old one back. I find several flaws with the new machine. First of all, we have a "whole house" water filtering system which we love. I would think it would be great for a coffee maker, but now Keurig is telling me all my problems are because of our filtering system. I was told to use spring water in it and it seems to work (well, 3 cups so far), but that 3 more than I got with our filtered water. I find it hard to believe I am going to have to start buying water after already spending the money for a really nice filter system. And, another REALLY big thing I don't like is that my coffee mugs I had been using with my previous system won't work with this one. It hold 12 ounces of coffee just perfect and it is too tall to use without having to remove the drip tray, which is really ridiculous. I really, really want to like this machine but so far I've found nothing about it better than my old one. Not a very happy customer.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: kodak_jack
review_text: It is easy to get caught up in the models and prices of Keurigs. The base one is about $99, but for a few dollars more you can move to this one. For a few dollars more, you can go into that one. Before you know it, you're buying this thing and it's more than most people need. If you aren't going to be making a carafe of coffee, you can go smaller than this. The reservoir holds enough for a small army. If you don't need to have 36 K cups at your disposal, don't get the three drawer storage base either. Both take up a lot of room on your countertop. Most people buy a Keurig for the convenience. There are hundreds of coffees that come in K cups, so, don't buy the silly filters that let you load your own coffee because then you take the entire convenience factor away! They are a genuine PITA to empty/ clean afterwards. What I'm trying to tell you is don't get carried away and buy more than you need. If you brew one cup of coffee at a time and don't really have to choose a super hot or very strong cup, then just get the basic one and be done with it. Do NOT buy the silly reusable filter. If you have coffee left over from your last coffee maker, either give it to somebody or throw it away. Remember, you are buying this for convenience. If you need to make a carafe at a time, buy a regular coffee maker for a fraction of the cost.
review_title: Don't Buy More Than What You Really Need
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: STAR STRUCK
review_text: We have had a Keurig ever since they've come out. Keurig is a wonderful company that really takes care of they're customers. They make me feel that we're important to them. ANYWAY! This coffee maker is wonderful! What does it feature? Let me say first, I've never seen it mentioned so maybe it's something I alone was bothered by... The way the cup sits on the tray I can add things to it while coffee flowing in. Before there was just barely room to put a spoon over the edge of the cup to drop some sugar in. The cup now has room for me to put in my coconut oil and sugar while it's pouring in. Not a big deal admittedly but it always did bother me a tiny bit. I probably never would have said anything as I just figured I was the cause of the announce, (don't put things in until it's finished), but since it's no longer a problem I want to sing those praises! The huge reservoir is fantastic! Really like the lid that catches itself up so you can fill it easily. I did purchase the my kcup 2.0 to go with it and thrilled that you use the same one for a cup or a mug or a carafe. It's very easy to use with the inside tab. I'm so happy about how it goes into the Keurig!!! You simply slide down a small ring and pop it in. When you remove it it snaps back in place, (Pointing to it in the photo). Love all the size choices too! Even has a strong setting that truly does effect the flavor of the coffee! You can set the night light on a timer and pick your colors for the night light and the reservoir light, not to mention all the wall papers! But of course you're buying it to make coffee. HA! Nice to have all the extras!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size
