review_text: I loved my older Keurig, but it was several years old, getting the used look, so I decided to upgrade to the K575 and give old faithful to my son for use in his auto shop. After one week, I traded him back my new K575 for my old faithful, which is still working just fine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: jaz
review_text: I have owned this Keurig for about 6 months. I noticed that it is growing mold only around the reservoir light, and there is no option to turn the light off (I didn't notice it sooner because I was using the green nightlight, and the mold growing is the exact same shade of green as the light). I have tried taking the machine apart to remove the bulb, but the bottom will not come off without breaking it. I have also tried calling Keurig to determine if they can give me a way to turn off the light. There is no way to turn off the light or replace the bulb (another problem in and of itself with this model). They told me that I should clean the machine with vinegar, and gave me the option to either replace the reservoir or get a new machine, same model.  I'm not a biologist, but I'm pretty sure that the heat from the nightlight is causing the mold to grow. I also have a Brita that I wash about once a month, and it does not have mold growth like the Keurig, so it must be related to the heat given off by the light. I've determined that this machine is not worth the hassle. Luckily I bought it from Costco and will be able to return it.
review_title: but I'm pretty sure that the heat from the nightlight is causing ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: arbie
review_text: I have an older Keurig model that actually seems to be much more reliable than this unit.  Almost every day, the needle gets clogged, and I have to use the cleaning attachment.  This really stinks when I'm in a rush to get out the door in the morning.  I like my coffee strong, but I've found that selecting this option on the machine only seems to make the needle clog even more frequently.  I always have to wait at the machine after pressing "brew" to see if it will start dispensing, and when it halts without any output, I have to immediately power it down and open the capsule compartment to try to save the pod and prevent coffee grounds from leaking everywhere.  This machine has behaved like this ever since I received it as a replacement for the one I originally bought in a department store.  That one had a similar issue but not even cleaning the needle with the attachment would get it to work. I really like that the older machines can sense when the water level is high enough, whereas with this new model, the "fill water" message remains until you manually press the button to continue. I have to agree that Keurig took a step backwards with the introduction of the 2.0 line.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Paul A. Steffen
review_text: It was broken when I got it. Leaked water all over the counter, and would shut off after about 1oz. I called Kurig, and they are sending me a new machine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazonian
review_text: When our old Keurig machine suddenly died, we purchased one of these at a local warehouse store (Amazon didn't have same day delivery on the item).  What a mistake!!!  The first one was DOA -- the touch screen had a fault, causing the entire machine to reset at certain points.  Returned and exchanged.  The second unit seemed to work fine -- until we put in a K-Cup and got a screen that said "Oops!  This pack wasn't designed for this brewer".  Did some research and found out that Keurig -- in their infinite stupidity and a severe case of corporate greed -- invented some sort of "digital rights management" system for their new brewers that prevents you from using third party K-cups in their brewers.  Not all of our K-Cups are third party, but some are -- and we like them.  Therefore, we declared this unit defective and took it back for a refund.  Found a brewer (NOT a Keurig) that works just fine with anything.
review_title: A bad combination of poor construction and corporate greed
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: FaerieFire99
review_text: Some of the reviews on here are pretty old. Because of the "spy cam" and other reviews saying they were unable to use reusable pods, I ALMOST didn't buy this. However, I have a few friends who have and use this model WITH reusable pods they fill with the coffee of their choice. So I decided to take the risk. I ordered reusable pods that stated were for the Keurig 2.0 300, 400, 500 series. One a carafe size and one single. They both work just fine. Having said that, I have not tried an older reusable pod that would have been made before the 2.0 series. For me, even if I had, I wouldn't have minded paying the $12 for the set I currently have to use this machine. I afore the features! I love how much I can customize it, from the color of light under the reservoir to how many minutes or hours the unit stays on. I really like I can program my personal cup, my boyfriend can get his, our daughter has one (for hot chocolate), and we have one for the carafe. For us, this Keurig is a convenient and helpful addition to our mornings.
review_title: A reply to older "spycam" negative reviews
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: DD
review_text: has some issues
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: E. D.
review_text: We drink way too much coffee in our house & want that afternoon kick so we bought a Keurig to make just the amount we need easily. Unfortunately we tried every brand & roast of Kcups & even bought a reusable kcup so we can just use our own coffee. Every single cup is way too weak for our taste & there are tons of reviews quoting this same issue.
review_title: Every cup of coffee is weak
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: EVANS CLASSROOM
review_text: I had a really old Keurig machine and it finally broke so, I had to get a new one I was looking around online and saw the Keurig K575 on sale a while ago and brought it. As soon as I pulled it out of the box. I loved it, it was shiny and beautiful. After you get out of the box to set it up you have to plug it in. Make sure you plug it in where you want it because after you plug it in and set it up then unplug its loses all its information and it doesn t use previous K-Cups just the new ones and doesn t allow you to use your own coffee. It also has a lot of great features like according to the Amazon  choose from five temperature options and utilize strength control setting to brew a bolder cup. Plus, brew 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 ounces of hot water on demand.  The website also says  80 ounces  water reservoir allows you to brew more before having to refill with our largest reservoir option.  and when you put a K-Cup in it recognizes it and then changes the temperature and size based on the drink. I like the recognizing feature, the hot water, I also like that it heats up fast and brews pretty fast and it turns itself off after a while but I don t like that you can t unplug it without getting rid of the setup information, it took me a while to remember. If you need a nice and fast coffee maker and other drinks this is a great product for you, it has a quick reheat time. Has recognize K-Cup feature but can t be unplug, but does turn does turn off after a while. I think anyone will love this coffee maker, if you need a great coffee maker you should buy this one.  (Amazon).
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Brian L. Peterson
review_text: Don't buy this one. Our new machine persists in blowing up K-cups, of various brands, all with the Keurig label. Typical scenario is that the brew stops about half way through, a nice warning about "pressurized cup" appears on the touchscreen, and when the cup is removed, one is rewarded with a shower of hot water and coffee grounds. Despite many applications of the special needle cleaning cup, plain hot water brews, etc., no luck. Just spent many fruitless minutes with the Keurig tech - did I mention that this machine is only about 4 months old - and his ultimate suggestion was to start dissecting K-cups, presumably looking for secret hidden flaws. Really? Did I mention that the same problem happened across multiple brands, all proudly bearing the Keurig label? Done. We give up. Time to find a new brand.
review_title: Don't purchase this unless you enjoy showering in hot water and coffee grounds
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Neal Schultz
review_text: I have been a Keurig user for about 5 years now.  My initial comment is that I am on my third Keurig machine in that time period.  This probably not a ringing endorsement of the engineering/durability of this unit.  My headline really says it "when it works...it's great".
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: carmen
review_text: Thus is a replacement to my older model Keurig that my daughter took...the chrome mom is outstanding asking with the matching kcup holder underneath
review_title: Thus is a replacement to my older model Keurig that ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: kim williams
review_text: I am not a keurig expert however I bought this same model at sams and so far no problems. Other reviews stated you can only use keurig brand k cups. I have been using great value k cups(wal mart brand) mccafe (mcdonalds brand) no problems. I saw another review that stated you can't use your own coffee. It came with a reusable filter and a carafe option. I made a full carafe no problem put my coffee in the filter and viola! Not sure about old k cups not fitting though..But you wouldn't buy a 2016 Mustang and expect to use parts from a older model mustang. Over all it's a nice machine does the job..The water storage is great..The touch screen is easy to use..I didn't have to read a book to figure it out. The only reason it didn't get a 5 star is because the carafe did not come with it..That kinda sucks. And apparently its not something sold at Walmart not sure about other stores haven't got that far yet but the ones online are pretty pricey..It has that option it should come with all the parts to be able to use it.I hope this helps..
review_title: I have been using great value k cups(wal mart brand) mccafe (mcdonalds brand) no ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jack Stevens
review_text: I love this thing for the first six cups. The coffee was hot something my old Keurig couldn't do. On cup number seven it started struggling and you could hear the pump straining then the dreaded "brewing was interrupted sign came on the screen. When I opened the machine to extract the k cup it was under pressure and coffee grounds squirt out. I imm thought the cup bottom piercer was clogged. I Took it apart and the needle was clear. I looked in my cup and it was full of grounds. I did the recommended cleaning and ran another cup. It also filled my cup with grounds and the bottom of the cup was rounded like there was to much pressure in the pump. I tried everything to make sure the machine was clean an ran several k cups through the machine out of 6 I got 0 cups that were drinkable.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: JNH
review_text: In 2005, my wife and I stayed in a B&B in Vermont where they had this curious little machine called a Keurig Coffee Maker in the main room for guests to use.  This was our first introduction to what would soon become our only means of making coffee.  We have only had a couple of machines and we upgraded just to get some of the new features.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: G. Plude
review_text: So as a coffee maker it works fine.  It's considerably louder than my old generation platinum brewer that gave up after 7 yrs.  The noise sounds more like it is giving birth rather than brewing coffee.  I'm giving it 3 stars because of what I consider very misleading information.  Of all the new brewers only this model notes "on demand hot water" so I foolishly thought that meant hot water that is not going through the same path as coffee.  Any real tea drinker HATES coffee flavored water in their tea.  So a separate hot water channel would be a bonus with a brewer like this.  So I contacted Keurig to confirm that the on demand hot water is separate and it is not.  The response was if you are getting coffee flavor in your tea then perhaps run a few plain water brews before getting hot water for making tea.  Well hell, based on that instruction any brewer has 'on demand hot water'; run the brewer w/o a pod!
review_title: A good brewer but false advertising
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Christopher Pane
review_text: This is probably the most frustrating, flawed product I have ever purchased. At first we were intrigued by the ease in which you could make coffee with it. Then it started to seize up, loosing its ability to suck up the water out of the reserve. We would regularly descale it and change the water filter per the instructions, but have no luck. I would find myself searching youtube to find videos on how to unlock these units (Its a very common problem). In the end, I'd be jamming a paperclip into the clogged holes in the dispenser to try to unclog the coffee residue buildup that accumulates inside. Once I'd get it working again, I'd flush it thoroughly, and flush it pretty much after each use to try to avoid the problem. All of this with no luck, about every 3-4 months it would get totally blocked up. We're done with it, its in the trash. Wish we could get your $200 back, but its out of warranty.
review_title: Take my advise, do NOT buy this product, it has major flaws !
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Flowtronics
review_text: Keurig has mastered keeping your business by monopolizing your coffee purchases. This machine only accepts 2.0 pods to limit what coffee you can buy and ensures that you keep your money in Keurigs pocket. This machine also dictates which brew sizes you can do as each pod can only brew roughly 3 different volumes varying by 2ish ounces.
review_title: Good for one single cup of Coffee at a time only.  everything else is done terribly
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Received yesterday, followed instructions to clean water reservoir and cycle water through the machine. Tried using it for hot water only last night, and water tasted like burnt plastic - really strong taste. Tried making coffee this morning, water (and thus the brewed cup of coffee) again tasted like burnt plastic. Re-washing the reservoir and K-Cup holder and cycling water through a few more times but if that doesn't work, it's going back. I had an older Keurig model before this one for a few years and NEVER had this issue, so I don't know what they've changed in terms of materials and manufacturing but I wish they'd go back to what they were doing before!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: C. Evans
review_text: Before I got one of these machines I thought is was just another redundant kitchen appliance. But it proved itself immediately. For one, you can get a fresh cup of coffee in 1 minute. Then somebody wants decaf. No problem. Then someone wants tea. No problem. There's also no mess. My drip coffee maker was always leaving stains and drips. I highly recommend getting a single serve coffee machine that has a large water reservoir for convenience. The touch screen also makes it a lot easier to teach people how to use it. Some models have too many buttons to choose from. People warned me that the coffee pods are expensive but that's not what I'm finding. Often the grocery store has a big discount loss-leader promotion. Also, I find that I'm drinking only one or two cups instead of making a whole pot and drinking four or five cups so it actually uses less coffee. It also makes great tea from loose leaf tea, better than steeping it. So, 5 stars!
review_title: Never going back to my old coffee maker!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Kristen H.
review_text: The machine itself is fine. Not super happy about the need for the special K cups but there are workarounds. The biggest problem I had was that we thought we were also supposed to get the carafe with this unit as well since it is pictured with the main set of pictures that preview the unit. Also lesser models in the stores for less money come with a carafe but not this. This unit the only added feature over the other unit is that it has the larger water tank and costs $30 to $40 more. But you're talking a few ounces and so definitely not worth it in my book especially since the other comes with the carafe. Very disappointed in that. I would have spent less and had it immediately from the local store with the carafe. Just a disappointment overall with the sale and handling.
review_title: The machine itself is fine. Not super happy about the need for the ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: S. Fox
review_text: I only had this brewer for nine months when it quit on me.  I was good about cleaning and descaling the machine since my kids like to use it for making hot chocolate, so I'm really disappointed in its quality.  The machine did have some good points; the adjustable temperature always ensured piping hot coffee and I enjoyed the variety of cup sizes available.  I didn't use the carafe that often since the larger K cups are hard to find and a carafe simply doesn't yield that  much coffee.  It's easier to keep a regular coffee pot on hand for entertaining.  I won't be spending this much on a Keurig brewer again.  If I do buy another one, it will be a basic model.  Hopefully, a simpler machine will mean that there is less to go wrong!
review_title: Stopped working in less than a year!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Susan DS
review_text: I am so sick that I spent even one dollar on this.  I was so stupid for not listening to folks about the restrictions keurig puts on the consumer.  You do not get the full menu, even on the k-cups thru send you in the box, much less on any that we have tried so far.  So I tried the magnet hack. This worked like a charm for about 2 weeks.  Now we're back to being restricted again. Keurig makes so much money on us yet when we buy their product it's as though they monitor us the entire time telling us what we can and cannot do with their product after we pay for it.  So, apparently the 2.0 monitors the ink used in the ladles of the k cups,  the Barcode,  the writing on the lid,  the size and shape of the k cup.  Good lord!  I'm so afraid that poor keurig will never make enough money off the common people.  In order to be able to use the machine they way most people want, you have to cannabalise it.  ?
review_title: Go back to Mr. Coffee! Save your money!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: First of all I have had 4 Keurigs, bought one for my mother, my daughter and my son and I have loved all of those previous models!  Don' Buy this model or any 2.0.  I bought a Keurig 2.0 and after 4 cups of coffee - stopped working.  Called help line and they told me to get a paper clip to clean needle.  Cleaned the needle -  2 K cups before exploding hot water and grounds everywhere.  Called company again - replaced with the K757 - it did the exact same thing.  Told me that the sealed K-cups were the problem - I need to push them down on the needle to release air.  Did it - put about 2 ounces out and stopped.  Opened it up - pick K-cup up and hot water and grounds everywhere.  Then customer service rep sent me directly to corporate - they said it was because I had soft water - REALLY!!!! How many houses have water softeners?  After only using 3 k-cups with this BRAND NEW Machine it quit working. Get the paper clip out?  WRONG! What a joke - I kept saying you have a design flaw.  No - It works great???  Just admit it Keurig!  So they sent me a older model. Waiting to get that to arrive!
review_title: my daughter and my son and I have loved all of those previous models
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Lisa Pappas
review_text: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this keurig! My son purchased this unit for me for mother's day, and I could not be more pleased! I ditched my Cuisinart for this unit, and do not regret it one bit!
review_title: Love this Coffee Maker! Ditched my Cuisinart!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Laura Chamness
review_text: If I could give it 0 stars, I would. Do not waste your time or money on this machine. I received one for Christmas Dec. 2017. After a few weeks, the K-Cups started exploding, pouring grounds into my coffee cup, and the machine gave an 'under pressure' error message. We followed the instructions to resolve the 'under pressure' warning...only that did not resolve the issue. Many K-Cups wasted and one frustrated coffee-drinker. I called Keurig, they offered to send a new machine, and gave a coupon for a free box of K-Cups. I was happy - or so I thought. New machine arrived...same problem persisted. I called Keurig again...another new machine shipped. Same problem persisted. Do you see where I am going with this?? After months of round and round with Keurig, and 4 new machines, they finally escalated the issue to a manager and she sent me the Keurig Elite. Now THAT is an awesome machine. Do yourself a favor...skip the 2.0 models and go straight for the Elite.
review_title: Horrible Waste of Time and Money
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: jon hergert
review_text: I've had five of these over the last 6 or seven years that typically made 1-2 cups of coffee per day.  The best one of them lasted 18 months, most of them only 12 months.  After the first 3 failed, we started using exclusively distilled water in the last two, the pump eventually failed anyway.  It was really a pain in the neck getting distilled water for the machine as well.
review_title: The best one of them lasted 18 months
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ashley S.
review_text: One star for the restrictions everyone else mentions (and you don't realize are there until you buy this POS machine and go through their crappy free official kcups). Sure, there are hacks, but I shouldn't have to hack my own coffee machine that is designed entirely for convenience at the expense of quality. Frankly, the off-brand k cups I use make a much better cup. If keurig really wants my business on a continual basis, they need to make their k cups less stale and gross, rather than resorting to hidden restrictions that punish customers.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Had one for 18 months.It had a few glitches,broke once .I was told they were sending a new one.never got it .when I called to ask what happened to it ,I was told I'm not getting a replacement ,just a replacement part.I said fine well where is it and they said we don't know but will send it.I finally got it.it worked fine until one day the power to the house went out for a second.now my keurig just pours water constantly.I called and did everything they said and nothing worked and I couldn't get a replacement.They treated me like trash.no more keurig for me.its not worth it .
review_title: Rude customer service,bad product and no restitution made
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: RR
review_text: Poor design for the touch screen, which constantly failed; among other electrical issues. Required frequent (i.e., every two weeks) cleaning of the internal components or an error code would appear and become inoperable. Dripped for about three minutes after every brew filling up the tray below. No matter what setting was used it made bitter coffee. Programming the unit was useless and included odd things like the color of the back light and wallpaper. What do those things add to the coffee s flavor? Answer, nothing! The K-cups are not environmentally friendly either and probably add tons of plastic to landfills! All-in-all, a bad product and one to be avoided.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Daniel Mtanous - USA
review_text: I received my Keurig K575 Platinum today. I am enjoying it immensely.
review_title: First Keurig! Brewed Coffee, Tea, and Hot Cocoa K-Cups and all are tasty and HOT!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Krith
review_text: Stay away. After owning this for about a year, we are trashing it. The first Keurig brewer we had always seemed to have problems clogging up even with multiple vinegar cleanings. So we upgraded and bought this one. After a few months, about half the K-Cups started exploding near the end of the cycle. At first we thought it was a bad batch, but it has done this with multiple brands/flavors ever since, with most of them being our beloved donut shop Keurig brand. Right now we have to place a strainer over our coffee cups to catch the potential grounds. And when they explode, it is a lot of cleanup.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: K. Simmons
review_text: I like everything about this Keurig accept when it comes time to descale the machine. There s no  cleaning mode  so you have to stand there and hold the water button down and drain the system 6oz at a time. It takes forever to drain it 2 or 3 tanks to make sure it s clear of chemicals. So clear a day off just to clean it. I m assuming other people put it off like I do and then end up having to buy a new machine. More sales for the company, but so frustrating for the consumer!  I would love for my next machine to have a  cleaning mode  if anyone from Keurig reads these reviews... or at least a cleaning pod so I can walk away from the machine while it drains 10 oz. I ve dumped a pod out and taped the top back on, it works for the first round, but I had to dump out and tape 2 more to get through the whole process.  Love the coffe and the machine until it s time to clean it!
review_title: Cleaning process takes WAY too much time!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Heather Jones
review_text: I have been a huge fan of Keurigs for 7 years. I defend their coffee when people complain about how watery and gross it is. I defend their product when people complain about how horrible the cups are for the environment.
review_title: Worst coffee maker I've ever owned
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Frumious
review_text: My business partner, who had a perfectly serviceable Mr. Coffee drip brewer recently replaced Mr. C with this sculpted, whirring contraption.  He is so enchanted with the machine and so proud of himself for buying it, that he put the machine in the center of his Etruscan marble-top kitchen table.  He and I start each business day in his kitchen having a cup of coffee.  Maybe my taste palette is dead from years of Mr. C. coffee, but coffee from this new machine tastes EXACTLY like the old stuff.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Roger
review_text: Unit only lasted 2 months before time kept resetting, Unit was replaced and about 4 months later the unit starting doing the same thing, left it go as unit still functioned. Around the 6 month mark the unit started to completely power off as if the unit was unplugged, Replaced AGAIN !!!!! this is the third unit and now my reuseable carafe is giving me a "opps message" !!! Keurig states that this is an unlicensed product and that they do not make a reusable carafe filter. My argument is that the reusable pod worked in the original AND the first replacement unit, yet Keurig only wants to issue a coupon for a free box of coffee......So now I have a $35.00 Stainless steel 2.0 carafe that is a paperweight....save the time and YOUR money and do NOT buy this product.
review_title: Unit only lasted 2 months before time kept resetting, ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: george w.
review_text: When it works it is OK. Coffee tastes pretty good. But the negatives out weigh any positives for me. Most annoying is their attempt to be proprietary with the coffee pods. We use one at work and my boss buys costco pods (because the Keurig brand is too expensive) and half the time the machine will give you an "Oops! It looks like you are not using our brand of pods" warning and you have to struggle to get it to actually brew. Or it gives you any number of other reasons why it will not work. And when it does work you have to stand and wait  while it laboriously pumps out your cup.  Remember the good old days when you went to the break room and just poured yourself a cup of coffee. From a coffee pot? Not that hard. This seems like a solution in search of a problem and the solution has problems of its own.
review_title: Does Not Work Well With Other Pods
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: couponconnie
review_text: It clogs & won't let water through the line.  I use bottled water & have tried to maintain by purchasing and using all the cleaning systems available & the vinegar method.  A couple of weeks & it stops working again.  This is the second one I have purchased since the first one did the same thing.  I've had it with Keurig and bought another brand.  Hooray!!  No problem. Don't waste your money or time trying to call the Keurig people--you won't get any satisfaction.
review_title: Keurig overated.  Problems with clogging even using bottled water.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Gabriella
review_text: I used to be a religious Keurig user, and I was really excited and wooed with how fast it could crank out drinks, all with the touch of a button and insertion of a teeny tiny pod! However, after a couple months, I realized that it wasn t so great. I m a barista, and I m really in love with coffee and how it tastes, and where the beans come from. I experimented a lot with my Keurig, but even with the best beans I had, and finding the  best  settings, it was still missing the mark. The Keurig is physically incapable of reaching a certain temperature, which the beans need, in order to be balanced. Brewing my own coffee was a really exciting endeavor that was unfulfilled by the Keurig. I commend the system for its efficiency and convenience, but in regards to capturing taste and brew, it definitely does not do the job.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Zach
review_text: Our touchscreen failed after a year, making the entire overpriced coffee maker useless. We talked with Keurig Warranty/Customer support and they were zero help. Don't waste your hard earned money on this piece of junk. If your dead set on mediocre yet convenient Keurig coffee like the majority of the developed world, get a machine with physical buttons. I've since reverted to a home grinder and espresso machine to make Coffee, Ice Coffee, Espressos, Lattes, and Cappuccinos... and it's the best decision I have made in years (I forgot Coffee could actually taste amazing when it's not from a stale K-Kup).
review_title: Touchscreen Failed in Less Than A Year... Making This Useless
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Katie Johnson
review_text: This is our third Keurig machine, we have used them for the last six years and loved them.  When we got this machine we instantly had pressure issues and wasted dozens of Kcups.  I was about to return the machine but decided to call Keurig  and see what they had to say.  The gal on the phone went through the usual remedies that I had already tried and then asked me about the water we use.  We have a water softener in our house.  She then told me that we will have to buy spring bottled water...  She said there is a reaction with the coffee that causes to much pressure for the machines if you have softened water.  I didn t believe her but thought I would give it a try.  Sure enough since switching water over a month ago we have had zero issues.  I don t like having to buy water special for this machine but I like my coffee more...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ben T.
review_text: Very disappointing...after a few brews it would flash a high pressure warning and say needle maintenance required. Never had that on our old keurig. Called customer service and a very nice woman walked me through what needed to be done. After that no problems for a few weeks. I would use the special needle cleaner to clean it once a week and would brew a cup of water before and after each cup of coffee to ensure everything was cleaned out. But it is ridiculous to pay that much for a coffee maker to have so many problems and maintenance issues with it. I have wasted just as many k cups as I have brewed with this machine and no matter how much I service it (exactly as keurig tells me to) it still is hit and miss on a successful brew. Would not recommend...save your money.
review_title: Called customer service and a very nice woman walked me through what needed to be done
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: S. Higginbotham
review_text: Apparently, "Keurig" is supposed to mean "proper" in Dutch, but there is nothing proper in a company consistently making worser and worser products.  I remember my first Keurig, in 2008.  I'm not even sure if it actually broke; I think I just replaced it thinking newer=improved.  That one broke down within two years.  Bought another one--that lasted one year.  This last is four months old, and is already crapping out.  With the K575, Keurig helpfully provides you with a plastic thingy to use on the machine's needle WHEN, not IF, it acts up.  "Here", Keurig says, "Make our design problem your morning routine."
review_title: Keurig's Business Model:  How can we make our next machine worse?!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: EClaire
review_text: Horrid plastic taste of this brand-new machine won't go away despite half-day cleaning, running, more cleaning, airing, vinegar, etc. Tank smells like plastic, and so does the puncture area. I posted a question and the manufacturer's suggestion was for me to buy their "descaling" thing (which I shouldn't have to do because this is a new machine). I want to like this machine, and I want it to be a time-saver, but so far it's sucking the joy and time-saving from my coffee.
review_title: Tank smells like plastic, and so does the puncture area
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: TWard
review_text: Makes a good cup of coffee and it's convenient BUT it's overpriced and not reliable. I purchased advertised "compatible k-cups" at Bed & Bath to brew my own coffee and the Keurig maker said the cup was incompatible so had to return the pod. Had to purchase the $15 Keurig brand kcup to brew instead. It worked. However, after 1 month the display screen displays a blank screen between brews and you have to unplug to reset. Did this multiple times and finally called Keurig. Surprisingly they are sending a replacement Keurig. Luckily my husband purchased the 2.0 with reward points earned through his employer so it hasn't cost us anything except the k-pod cup to brew our own grounds. I am definitely glad I didn't pay for the unit. We'll see how long the replacement lasts. I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone. Way overpriced for the quality.
review_title: Makes a good cup of coffee and it's convenient BUT it's overpriced ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: SandyK1614
review_text: We bought this unit because my husband needed a programmable carafe.  Everything on the box says we could do this with no issue.  Problem is you can ONLY use Keurig pods which are priced at 8 for $16.00.  While buying the coffee maker there were several elongated pods that said they would work for the 525,  what they meant is it was only for a cup .. NOT a carafe.  Coffee takes longer to make as it is always heating when you want to make a cup and makes weird sounds much like the Tardis on Dr. Who and still takes longer than our old Keurig.  Keurig thinks very highly of themselves.  We are returning this unit.  $160.00... ridiculous!  The Shark Ninja will let you make a carafe and use your OWN coffee.
review_title: Coffee takes longer to make as it is always heating when you want to make a cup and makes weird sounds much like the Tardis on Dr
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: K. Bowling
review_text: Took three of these back! When our old mom 2.0 series broke from years of use, we bought this as a replacement. Three times. The reason this was necessary is beside coffee brewed in the new model tastes horrible. We did several tests with the same water and coffee and were amazed that the taste between the product brewed was so markedly different. And if we had only tried one 2.0, I would have thought it was s lemon. But the whole line appears to suck. Not sure what we will do now because we loved our old machine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: beekay
review_text: As others have said, not as good as the classic series.  I replaced my older K75 (I think), which started leaking.  I found the K575, to be louder, and it takes longer to get a cup of coffee, probably closer to 2 minutes.  While it was making the coffee, you could hear the pump struggling.  It just didn't sound like this was going to last.  Also, as stated elsewhere older K cups, or non-Keurig licensed K-Cups will not work, unless you want to waste time trying to work around the machine with a hack.
review_title: Didn't seem as well made as the older series machines.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: amo
review_text: The machine is very pretty and I love the display and led light.  Programs easy and water is on demand.  It does get a little hotter than older models, enough to use a dab of cold milk without having to microwave it hot again.  But the drip tray won't stay locked and the Keurig famous chrome handle of fingerprints...needs a black deco part on the very front of the handle.  I ordered the bulk coffee adapter and I hope it will make the coffee as strong.  Still a little expensive for the tech. But a Good effort Keurig.  Ps. This is for single coffees.  If you like huge cups of java get a Bunn and hook it to your water system.  12oz is plenty for me.
review_title: Drip tray won't stay in place, not hot enough but better
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: imarunnergirl
review_text: We had to exchange our first one after it didn't work. Subsequently, we've watched the touch screen on this one go bonkers for months just willing it along - we've had it less than 9 months. It also doesn't brew consistent cup sizes, we've measured.  I previously had a Cuisnart that lasted for years and I'm going back - it's worth the extra little bit of money.
review_title: Inconsistent brew, touch screen gone haywire
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Melinda P.
review_text: Tis time to speak of many things.  Love the two Keurig's we have, but have never had the need to contact their customer service until today, absolutely one of the worst customer service experiences I have encountered.  Gave my old B60 maker to my older neighbor and somehow she reset the coffeemaker so it wouldn't brew.  As it was several years old, I contacted Keurig - representative said that unless I provided the serial number they could not and didn't, assist me. I have numerous Bose products and regardless of age they are always helpful, professional and courteous.  Mention this because the difference with Keurig is night and day.  If you don't plan to ever contact them, purchase their product.  However, make sure you keep the "Use and Care Guide" because you can't download another and if you can't read the serial number your out of luck.  What a disappointment for someone who has always championed the brand.
review_title: Great product - worst example of customer service I've encountered since Humble Abode
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Robert L. Christlieb
review_text: DAY 1 review ..baby blue version was on sale at best buy on holiday , i can't beleave they charge extra money for the red versions ? touch screen is good for dark rooms ..you dont want to wake up someone, then soon as you brew the sound will wake everyone sleeping ahahaha..sounds like its broken ..well i brewed a strong coffee cup was half full ..soo it said add water i pressed the button and it overfilled the cup ..thiers no off for water ? this very dum machine , well i try it for a week.
review_title: i got the blue ones cause it was cheaper than the red one ..no purple or pink ?
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: bb
review_text: This is the third maker I purchased like this.  I keep buying because it is convenient.  However they only last one year.  I make 2 cups each day and water quality going into the machine is perfect.  This will not last longer than a year and will leak or clog up.  Kurig needs to work on the quality of this product.  Plumbing joints are held together with zip ties that will leak on you. (how about using real clamps) This is made super cheap and it falls apart.  Keep in mind this is disposable like the K cups.  If you don't mind replacing every year this is the mackine for you.
review_title: Cheaply built and lasts a year - my thrid one
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Felicia
review_text: I love my Keurig. I have this exact same one. Had it since it hit the stores. Fortunately I did get mine at a department store and never had any of the problems some have had. Especially the person who s caught on fire. Just a suggestion but maybe if we didn t try to fix something that s not broken we wouldn t have so many problems. Just a thought! Don t understand why one person can try and make it not work by just not using a Keurig pod. If you re not using them why buy the coffee maker! Sorry but I Love their coffee and mochas. And only buy Keurig from a few years ago to present why the waste in filters and broken pots. No need. Love it.
review_title: Don t miss with the wires!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Anthony S.
review_text: Makes good coffee on the plus side however has some very poorly designed features. If you have a power failure and just need to reset the clock you have to wait until the machine totally heats up before you can even access the clock in the menu. Next the power button is placed in the touch screen bottom corner where it has a hard time seeing your finger. Works sometimes other times I have to stand there pushing over and over again because it will not respond. The touch screen finally broke because I pushed it too hard trying to get it to work. What's wrong with a real button? Real stupid design. I will never buy another one.
review_title: Makes good coffee on the plus side however has some very ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ahmei28
review_text: My previous Keurig, the first generation, I had for 3 years and loved it, but when the motor starting to whine and refused to make a cup it was time to junk it.  In January 2017 I purchased the Keurig K575.  Initially I thought it was great, as in it made a cup every morning. About 3 months of owning it, my friend came over and wondered why the special K-options aren't activated when I used k-cup. I went on-line and sure enough the special K-options weren't coming up.  To be honest, I didn't care too much about the options as I don't drink more than 12 oz. of coffee. However, that should have been clue that this Keurig was a dud.  In June 2016, the Low Pressure notice came up. I cleaned it per manual. Worked fine, but a week later the Low Pressure came up again.  Fast forward, it is now Feb. 2018, it makes 1 cup a week without the Low Pressure message.  When I do get a cup, its saturated with coffee grinds.  For the price, the poor customer service, and low quality of Keurig, I am currently looking for other brands on Amazon. STAY Away from Keurig!!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: E. Lam
review_text: BUYER BEWARE! I bought this keurig from bed bath and beyond about a year ago and just this morning when I wanted to brew my favorite coffee it gave me and  oops  message saying that the cups I ve been brewing for a year now are no longer compatible. I called the hotline and after getting my call dropped TWICE, the rep said that they were sending me a keurig elite brewer instead that doesn t have the led display screen and only does single brews. As of recently, bed bath and beyond is no longer selling this version. I believe the real reason will come out soon but with all the other reviews I ve seen on here, I m hoping that issue is the only one I ll have to deal with and I ll definitely take a new free brewer if it works. Keurig also requested that I send the defective pod holder as proof of ownership too so if you re having issues, definitely call the hotline so keurig as a whole can resolve these issues!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Teresa Thaut
review_text: This was a gift, but I will never buy one of these products again. My Keurig is 6 months old and when making a cup of coffee, it would just drip, drip, drip. I went through the cleaning process multiple times and it just seemed to get worse, not better. After being highly frustrated, I pulled out my Mr. Coffee. You spend a lot of money on these things, the very least they could do is work or the manufacture should not be selling them or nickel and dimming you to death, in order for it to make just one sticken cup of coffee.
review_title: I went through the cleaning process multiple times and it just seemed to get worse, not better
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: plasticman acrylic
review_text: I noted comments about low temps on the K575 and contacted Keurig about this. They believe that 192F is optimal for taste and have set 195 for Kcups and 197 for mugs. The post brew temp retention is in the hands of the user...warming cups and thermoses before filling. I have tested the taste effect with Panera Hazelnut Cr me ground coffee from Panera. They brew at 195F and even 5-7 degrees below that produces an inferior taste.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: B. Rose
review_text: The display on mine went our where it sometimes showed nothing and then sometimes static and mixed up things. Keurig customer service used to be awesome and they'd fix or replace the unit, no questions asked.
review_title: Keurig customer service used to be awesome and they'd fix or replace the unit
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Larry H. Harrison
review_text: My Keurig B70 just wore out and I couldn't justify $600 cost for a new one, but replaced it with the K575 - what a mistake! The engineers were so concerned with limiting type of K-cup, they forfeited the coffeemaker unit. First, brewing coffee (or tea) with this unit sounds like the well pump on my grandfather's farm and the clock on the thing is worthless, this unit's clock gains from an hour to 6-hours on a daily time table. I wish there had been somewhere to have gotten my old B70 repaired. I can say, I haven't had an issue with k-cup rejects.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Tony
review_text: makes fantastic coffee, but 80 oz. ?
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: MauryK
review_text: !! DO NOT BUY!! DO NOT BUY!!
review_title: This is the worst electronic appliance I have ever owned
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I have used Keurig brewers for over 10 years both at home and work and these new 2.0 made in china models are crap. The quality of materials is so poor you are lucky to get 1 year out of it. The features that they boast about are nice but if the unit only lasts a year its a very expensive high tech piece of plastic junk. When you call customer service for warranty replacement you can tell the associates are over whelmed with problem calls. My experience with the customer service dept was poor until I got the attention of a supervisor. The supervisor used canned phrases when I asked questions but after three calls I finally received a replacement.
review_title: The new Units are sub par quality that do not last/sustain over time .......
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: A.M.S
review_text: Don't buy this model (or any touch screen model).
review_title: Don't buy the touch screen model!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Have the original keurig (now four years old) in my in-law apartment. Its used every day and works flawlessly. We bought THIS piece of junk 2.0 unit less than a year ago. It was also used daily. The 2.0 makes small cups of coffee, the largest setting (10 oz) produces about 6-7 ounces of coffee since new. The 2.0 has the water tank on the BACK of the unit, so if you have near a wall you have to move the coffee maker to fill the water, the lid for the tank is a ridiculously complicated  shape that takes fiddling to replace. I could learn to live with these flaws, but the worst part of this machine is the maintenance. All keurigs need cleaning periodically, but this one requires at least 8 to 10 "maintenance operations" for every 1 that the original keurig does. Remember we're running these two machines in the same house, every day, with the same coffee pods. I love the keurig concept, and I'll buy another "original type" kuerig. This 2.0 goes out to the trash this week, 11 months old.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: yogi
review_text: Worked for a week before demanding maintenance, then for another couple months before demanding more. Quit altogether after six months.
review_title: Conked out, warm coffee, allows official K-cups only. Junk.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Felicityallmighty
review_text: First of all, I bought this coffee maker from Walmart so no fault at all is aimed at Amazon.  I have to say that the machine itself is beautiful and I was so excited to use it this morning. Unfortunately the 30 biodegradable pods I purchased were rejected by the machine.  The box said they were compatible with this model so I am very disappointed. The machine says "This pod is not compatible with this machine. Please use one of the 1000s of other compatible Kurig brand pods".  Really Kurig?! That's just tacky and makes me wonder if I should go with another brand of machine.  I just want to have my convenient cup of coffee and not destroy the earth at the same time. I will be returning this product tomorrow. :-(
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Anna Sinclair
review_text: This machine is so frustrating! It constantly needs to be cleaned or it won't work... or it'll brew coffee but will take 10 minutes to make one cup! The display screen keeps going blank and we have to leave it unplugged for hours to get it to come back on, and you can't brew coffee until the screen is fixed. There are times the display is simply messed up and you can still brew coffee at the 8 oz setting, but you can't change any of the settings when that happens. I prefer the more simplistic Keurig because it never had any of these problems. DO NOT BUY!
review_title: This machine is so frustrating! It constantly needs to ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: MikeB
review_text: Thought this would be an upgrade from my 2014 model, but it's actually a step backwards. The pump is so loud I can hear it from most rooms in the house. And it doesn't work with all my k-cups. I assume this is due to a "pay to play" licensing issue.  Just remembered a couple more things:  It fill cups slower than the older model and water temp isn't as hot. But, hey, you can customize the screen colors!
review_title: Very noisy and does not work with all k-cups
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Kepley56
review_text: If I could give it less than one star I would...total rip off...I had tea cups with their logo on the box that I used very successfully with the old model that I replaced but now they will not work because the official new logo or whatever keeps it safe from "unauthorized" products what not on the cup itself...what a total greed move...good bye Keurig ...I will go elsewhere for my brewers
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: RealMrBurgundy
review_text: Garbage. After a few months of use a few times per week, the machine decided to only make a full cup randomly. Tried multiple cleans, troubleshooting with keurig, online articles, and just plain tinkering because we were upset with the thing. Absolute junk, save your money and buy a nesspresso.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: S. Kenna
review_text: Worked good for a year then started to show error messages concerning needle cleaning. Cleaned manually with paper clip (royal pain) and solved problem for a little while. Now it is doing it again, cleaned with the auxiliary brewer maintenance accessory as instructed and ran 8 oz. fresh water cycle and very next coffee pod only half brew again with a cupful of grounds. Tossed into the trash as that is all it is worth !
review_title: Worked good for a year then started to show error messages ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: lmw
review_text: Ran through 3 full reservoirs of water to flush it out, but coffee still tasted like plastic. I've had other Keurig's and this was never an issue so something is wrong with this model or unit. It was returned.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Greybear
review_text: Do NOT purchase this or any other Keurig coffee maker. Most kcups purchased from Costco or the supermarket DO NOT WORK on Keurig 2.0 products. I am very tired of returning kcups. Must be a nightmare for stores. I wish I never gave away my old machine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Scotty beaming you up
review_text: After enjoying this unit for over 6 months, a slow leak has developed. I'm careful not to over fill (never even fill all the way up to the "Max Fill" line)
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Juliana Wall
review_text: Got Keurig as wedding gift less than 18 months ago. Was working fine, took good care of it, then all of a sudden it pooped out on us, no warning, no reasoning. The power source works but nothing is showing up on the display screen except a power button icon that doesn't do anything when pressed. We attempted basic troubleshooting (cleaned water filter, cleaned K-cup holder, turned up side down, unplug & re-plug) with no success.  Called customer service who had no further suggestions beyond what's in the manual, basically saying it's dead, but here's 35% off to buy a new one!  The discount is ridiculous because you can easily find one for the same price if on sale at Macy's.  Very infuriating.  And of course there's no where to TAKE the machine to try fixing it, they just repeat basic troubleshooting measures over the phone. Why on earth would I purchase another machine that'll likely crap out on me after one year?! I DO NOT recommend purchasing this Keurig or any other Keurig product as the company doesn't take care of it's customers.
review_title: Do NOT purchase this product or support Keurig company
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: maclifer
review_text: Just received a K575 Matte Black and really enjoy it.  Being able to control the on/off times for the warmer and the water temperature is a nice plus.  So far have made around 10 mugs with it including several Caramel Macchiato and the foamy top was perfect and yummy.  The night light, too, is a nice feature to have.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: D Cain
review_text: My original Keurig lasted over 8 years. I updated to this model and have had nothing but problems. Followed all the directions, cleaned regularly, used filtered water and still having problems. Keurig needs to figure out why these machines are breaking down so soon after being purchased. After nothing but problem after problem, day in and day out, I've chosen a high end drip coffee maker as my replacement. Tired of wasting K-Cups due to the brew always being interrupted. Very frustrating and disappointing. Will NEVER own another Keurig coffee maker.
review_title: Cheaply made and will not last
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: James F. Todd
review_text: UPDATE: Keurig finally replaced this under warranty...replacement went 3 weeks before starting same nonsense.
review_title: This model will shoot grounds all over....
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: David G.
review_text: Our first Keurig lasted 5 years.  It was bulletproof.  We drink a lot of coffee.  Since that first brewer bit the dust a little over a year ago we have gone through two of these brewers.  We are getting an error about the needle needing cleaned over and over after we clean the needle over and over.  It is also leaking lots of water after it brews.  Then every so often it decides to fill a cup full of coffee grinds.  I guess if we want to use K cups we are going to have to spend $125 for one of these every six months.  Bummer.
review_title: Our first Keurig lasted 5 years. It was bulletproof ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: The screen stopped working not long after the warrant period expired, in addition to having to pay more for k cups because it appears that the whole purpose of the internal computer is to have a reader that makes sure no "unapproved" brand is used.
review_title: Defective internal computer ruined coffee maker
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Joeswank
review_text: I like strong coffee. I'll get that out of the way. I've had my Keurig for a week now and have discover through trial and error that's impossible to get a strong cup of coffee from my Keurig 2.0. The best I can do is grind my own beans really fine and use the refillable cup, choose the lowest amount to be brewed and hope for the best.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Rimson79
review_text: We bought this directly from Keurig and not Amazon but I wanted to warn everyone to avoid this and probably all other Keurig models.  We have had nothing but problems with this model.  The main issue is that it is very sensitive to any variation in K-cups.  We have used multiple different K-cups from various vendors.  This unit works sometimes and other times if bursts the membrane and spills coffee grounds in the cup and throughout the machine requiring thorough cleaning.  We have also experienced multiple times that the machine had to be cleaned.  We had a Cuisinart before this one that I took to my work location.  The Cuisinart is still working fine.  We have never had a problem with it.  Using the same K-cups that exploded in the Keurig have had no problems in the Cuisinart.  I would strongly recommend that you avoid this machine.  It is far too sensitive and unreliable.  We have wasted close to 30 K-cups with this unit while wasting NONE with the Cuisinart.
review_title: Do not BUY KEURIG Coffee makers
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: SHAN P.
review_text: If you want. a coffee pot to last more than a year don't buy a Keurig especially if you drink more than 4 cups a day. Clogs, won't take certain pods without clogging, handle sometimes won't shut. Customer service is the worse. Im gong back to to my 7 year old Cuisinart coffee maker I never had any problems with it. I would of never purchased this but it was a gift so I thought we would try it out.
review_title: Customer service is the worse. Im gong back to to my 7 year ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Mary
review_text: Loved the large reservoir and all of the brewing options, but this machine was awful. I took back two of them before going back to my old "no bells and whistles" basic Keurig with the smaller reservoir.
review_title: Loved the large reservoir and all of the brewing options
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Patricia A. Balaban
review_text: I just bought this from another retailer. It has cool lights and backgrounds you can choose from. Pretty sweet. I got a reusable Kcup thinggy so I can use my own grounds with no problems. No adaptor or anything needed. Ok fine. Everything's good so far!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Brad Morawski
review_text: They did the dumbest thing for low water....nothing tells you the water level is too low until you load a k cup, set your oz, and push the brew button. At least 50 times I have pushed the buttons, walked away, came back a few min later to get my coffee and its flashing low water. When the water level is low....let somebody know. As an office coffee maker the person to empty it should fill it. Not the next person that tries to make a cup. Really dumb mistake on their part.
review_title: Really dumb mistake on their part
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Redheadchick
review_text: Stopped working after 6 months. I invested in this machine thinking that more money spent would be higher quality. I had my $30 coffee pot for 4 years and it still worked when I gave it away. The pot spits coffee grounds everywhere now and I ve done all the tips to  fix  it. After almost an hour waiting on customer service, see picture attached, I ve decided I will never buy another coffee maker from them.
review_title: Stopped working after 6 months. I invested in this ...
