name: j bell
review_text: Great for a single cup machine - but then I would have bought a single cup machine if that is all I wanted. Can't brew a 4-5 cup carafe of strong coffee, bogs down and says Brew Interrupted, Water Under Pressure. Very disappointing machine, will NEVER buy another Keurig if this is the kind of garbage that they are producing now. Machine is noisy, sounds like a hay thrashing machine.
review_title: Piece of garbage, Keurig has ruined it's reputation with this thing.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: C. J. Dobbler
review_text: This is my first Keurig. It was a Christmas gift. About a month after using it, it won't preheat the water when I turn it on. I have to unplug and plug it in several times to get it to preheat. I haven't even tried to program it yet to start brewing at a certain time. But I imagine with the preheat issue, it wouldn't work anyway.
review_title: This is my first Keurig. It was a Christmas ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: lbdlbd
review_text: I really like the fact that it holds a lot of water BUT the notion that it has a hot water dispenser is nonsense.  You need to make sure there is no old pod in the machine.  the water comes through the same spout.  If you have an older model, just take out the pod and brew.  Same hot water.  Just a selling ploy to add/show a new??? feature.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jessica Peachey
review_text: I didn't originally buy my keurig 2.0 from Amazon but I did purchase it from the Keurig website. I had so much trouble with this brewer that I decided to come on here to let everyone know about this product. I ordered this brewer after having a previous keurig for many years. In Jan we "upgraded" to this brewer. It never functioned correctly. You have to do weekly needle maintenance (nvr had to do that on previous brewer) but we still got error messages every time we used the brewer and coffee grounds spewed in our coffee. Keurig said this is a known issue and they sent us a replacement part. 1 week later and we had the same problem. They sent us a new brewer and the first cup of coffee did not work. After multiple calls we are exchanging this brewer for a new one. I have to say 1. This product is terrible and is definitely a KNOWN flawed product but 2. Keurig customer service was very kind and helpful even though calling every week was annoying. I would recommend other Keurig brewers over this one.
review_title: This product is terrible and is definitely a KNOWN flawed product but 2
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I'm on my second Kuerig and I think that's it for me. I had v1 which lasted about 2 years before it stopped working. I then bought the 2.0 version which i've had for less than a year. I noticed that the touch screen kept going blank about 6 months after purchasing it. I would have to unplug it, wait and then plug it in again for it to work. There is no On/Off switch other than the touch screen. This morning the screen went completely white and would not reset regardless of how many times I plugged/unplugged it. For such an expensive coffee maker I would think it would last more than 11 months.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Donald Hoversten
review_text: I bought a K575 and had lots of issues with 'brew interrupted, water under pressure' errors so Keurig sent me a new one.  It does the same thing.  The Keurig 2.0 system simply doesn't work.  If you want a reliable brewer, stay with the K55.  The 2.0 series is nice, but it just doesn't work reliably.  I'm surprised that Keurig doesn't just recall all of them.
review_title: 0 series is nice, but it just doesn't work reliably
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Cheryl R.
review_text: Lasted maybe a couple of months before the k-cups started sputtering and dumping coffee grounds into the cup below AND all over the machine front.  Did the descale and it works for a little while and then descale again.  The last descale did not stop the grounds from dumping all over the place.  I loved my first Keurig but won't buy another until this problem is solved.  I also liked the instant hot water feature for hot tea.  Not hot enough.  I have wasted a lot of k-cups trying to get a cup of coffee without grounds.  First thought the cups were over-filled and tried another brand....same problem.  Just gave it up!
review_title: I loved my first Keurig but won't buy another until this ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Jeff Hoover
review_text: I don't normally leave reviews but this machine doesn't work but about half the time and puts coffee grounds in almost every cup of coffee...It makes coffee just like the other Keurig coffee makers I have had in the past but will not allow you to use other brands of k-cups. The worst thing about the coffee maker is the mess that it makes. It pushes so much pressure into the k-cup the top blows out and spews ground everywhere. The needles are clean and I have tried all of the recommended fixes and none work. It is not practical to have to clean up grounds after most cups of coffee that also have grounds standing in the bottom.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Kenneth Kay
review_text: Thought I might have just bought a bad version of this coffee maker, but then I read a few other negative reviews here and realized that I wasn t alone. Misery do love company. Initially, I really loved this machine   for about six months   then the trouble started; repeated error messages, pod explosions, LED screen malfunctions, expensive descaling and needle maintenance ad nauseam. So   this morning, when coffee was really needed, this  thing  decided to play hard to get once again. Bad move, Keurig! My solution this time was to pitch it into the garbage. And not too gently, either. Now I m gonna go in search of a used Mr. Coffee. Last one of those I owned lasted ten years.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Oleg Popov
review_text: Unfortunately, I have purchased three of these machines and each one was broken!  Our first made warm coffee, not hot coffee.  Second, the digital  screen was broken.  The third machine clogged within a month.  That is when I figured it was not meant to be and purchased a nespresso and never looked back.  I do not recommend this machine.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: T G Nelson
review_text: Well, the comments about lack of compatability with old cups means I will not get a new Keurig machine. I also have a bunch of older style cups so I won't wast the money on a machine that will not let me brew the cup of coffee I desire.  So, I will finish off my old cups and look for a machine that is more user friendly.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: C&A Franklin
review_text: I have never hated a coffee maker more. EVER. I hardly know where to start on the list of peeves this brewer has presented. We've had this brewer for a few years so this is not a first impression but long term usage, but on the slip side some of these issues may or may not have been addressed.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: MomOf3
review_text: This is my 2nd keurig. i have the k45 one of the basic ones. So this is a nice upgrade. I only replaced the old one because I never got the filter for it, it just wasn t at the top of my list and the machine didn t remind like I thought it would. It held up well I descaled it when I had to but I probably need to do that more often than recommended. Anyways I hope this one reminds me often enough lol.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: joseph liotta
review_text: 6 months old and the company is sending me a new unit. This is my 3rd Keurig, and it is extremely high maintenance. In order to assure you HAVE to buy Keurig coffee, the machine clogs nearly every time you use a different manufacturers type of coffee. Several times a week it clogs while you are trying to get ready for work!
review_title: Would recommend NOT buying this model
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Darryl Nerone
review_text: Junk I bought brand-new and it made one cup of coffee. Blah, blah, under pressure clean blah, blah, blah. I turned it upside down over the sink and it gave me one more cup and that was it. There were no clogged inlet or outlet needles. It has internal design problems. I had it for an hour,  took it back and bought the classic version which also still accepts any "k" cup.
review_title: Defective right out of the box!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Tamra McVey
review_text: We were so excited when we got this unit. We only used it a few times a week. After a few months we kept getting error messages that says "water under pressure" perform needle maintenance. We took it apart as the book directed and rinsed out. Warning still comes up. It's too late to return. Now we have lots of left over K-Cups and no Keurig to make them in.
review_title: Only worked for a few months
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Linda Wallace
review_text: This coffee maker is a joke on its temperature settings, it says it has 5 different settings and it does but the temperature only is aprox 1 degree between each setting so low is 160 and high is 165 degrees big deal not worth the extra money if this is why you are purchasing it
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: jericho2
review_text: I received this as a Christmas gift.  It stopped working twice within the first couple of months and I cleaned the puncture prong area according to the multiple youtube videos out there.  No resurrection was possible the third time it quit less than 9 months after receiving it.  I emailed Keurig... no response.  Total junk as far as I'm concerned.
review_title: I received this as a Christmas gift. It stopped ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: G. Thompson
review_text: Our 6 year old programmable Keurig stopped working so we purchased this one.  Screen went blank after 1 month of use (2-3 cups per day). Tried the new Keurig Slim prior to this one that also stopped working after 5 weeks. Very disappointing.  Replaced with a Cuisinart single cup coffee maker at about the same price. It works flawlessly. Buy at your own risk.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: D. White
review_text: Very disappointed in the Keurig  K575 coffeemaker.  Nothing close to my old Platinum model.  The auto on timer on this unit is hit or miss.  Some days it works and the unit is ready when I get up in the morning.  Most days it doesn t come on and it must manually be turned on.  I reset it each day this occurs, but still no guarantee the auto on will work.  It is also very, very noisy.  The water pump as it pulls water from the reservoir and disperses water into the cup is extremely loud.  This will be my last Keurig!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: ShelBell
review_text: DO NOT BUY THIS... i loved my old Keurig, but this new one...NO!  Only had it for a month.  I Can't fit my tumbler under it, cheap handle feels flimsy like I'll break it every time, and worst of all, i get this error message about water pressure and the needle needing maintenance, resulting in a LOT of Coffee grounds in my coffee, and a mess of grounds and water when i take the pod out.  See photos.  I'm looking at a Cuisinart next time.  Good luck :) XO
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Map47
review_text: Love the simplicity of the 'set-up' and touchscreen! This is a replacement for my top-of-the-line Keurig from over 6 years ago, which finally died. I love being able to make a carafe, a travel mug, or a cup of coffee at a time. Also, the large water reservoir mean less frequent fill-ups. Another feature that my old one did not have was being able to adjust the 'strength of the brew. That makes a big difference. A very nice to have feature is the night light, which gives off a nice glow at night.
review_title: It's a very fast, flexible beverage brewer.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Peter Trzop
review_text: This goes back to my issue, why do presidents of companies not use their own products?  Set up is clunky at best, and my turns off either by unplugging or a setting to turn off after 15 minutes.
review_title: Ok, but better models out there
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Pat F
review_text: Buyer beware - had my Keurig for 2 years and recently began seeing the "blank screen" problem (do a google search on it). Unplugging and replugging the machine had fixed it until yesterday. It didn't work at all - even leaving it unplugged overnight. Apparently it is a known problem at Keurig that they have not fixed. Since my machine is out of warranty, it is not covered by Keurig - but they will offer me a discounted price on the purchase of a new Keurig with the same problem.....I wasn't born yesterday.... Just ordered an iCoffee machine....save your money....
review_title: Blank screen problem leaves machine unusable
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Ingrid P
review_text: I totally enjoyed my K575 and the wonderful cups of coffee it produced; a first Keurig Coffee Maker for me and such a stylish one at that.  I loved the convenience of having my coffee ready as I head out the door for work.  I did notice however the temperature of my coffee wasn't as hot as I prefer especially after adding my dairy creamer.  After a couple of months, I found myself heating coffee in the microwave for 30 seconds.  I finally sadly returned it but am looking to replace my coffee maker with another Keurig...probably the "Elite" model as the reviews were impressive.  I'll keep you posted.
review_title: I totally enjoyed my K575 and the wonderful cups of coffee it ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I have one of these but the touch screen got broken and after searching I couldn t find a better k-cup coffee maker. The only problem I ve had is the price. I m going to buy one from Sams for $100. Even used ones cost more on Amazon. This is the best maker though as it has a large and small k-cup option, strong and regular brew options, and a large easy to use  reservoir for water. It can even use regular grounds. On further examination I realized that the one from Sams doesn t come with everything that this one does and was out of stock so I bought this Amazon one after all.
review_title: Best maker but not the best price.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: sparkyjoe1
review_text: I have purchased 4 keurig coffee machines at bed bath and beyond. It covered a period of about 4 years. These machines are nice but they CERTAINLY DON'T LAST!!! I did all the maintance on these machines that are required and still they didn't last. The machine I have now will be dead soon and I will not buy Keurig again.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Toni K. Burniston
review_text: This was a gift from a friend. This makes a terrible cup of coffee. Coffee is supposed to brew. All this thing does is give one quick blast of hot water. The result was a cup of brown tasteless water!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: K.G.
review_text: We got one of these from my son for Christmas. It is WONDERFUL! My husband and I quit drinking coffee for several years but decided we'd try it again so I asked for a Keurig. And this is the one that we received. It works well and easily and makes an excellent cup of coffee. Love that we have alot of choices in what size we want too.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Emily
review_text: Love it! Brews a nice cup of coffee and I love the strong option. We do have to be careful to make sure the cups we buy are officially licensed, but we typically do anyways. We haven't had any issues with having the 'needle' get clogged with grounds, and the Keurig keeps track of the filter and lets us know when it's time to swap it out. Couldn't be happier!
review_title: Love it! Brews a nice cup of coffee and ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Linda Riek
review_text: This machine is inferior to the earlier machines...ours clogs up every time we use it...and when we clean it out (almost after every cup) --and run water through it --we get lots of coffee grounds out.  The machine will only make a cup of coffee one out of three tries.  Do not buy this!  It is a piece of junk.
review_title: This machine is inferior to the earlier machines.. ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Horrible plastic taste, and it does not recognize 2.0 cups all the time.  I am required to keep a 2.0 lid that it will recognize around to tape on the top of the 2.0 cups that it does not recognize.  I have never used it with a non 2.0 k-cup as I was aware of the change before I bought it.  If you are getting a replacement machine then it will not work with non 2.0 k-cups or other brands.  There are much better options.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: DonnaF
review_text: My husband purchased this. I am not a fan. The entire thing is plastic and looks cheap. It is very noisy while it's brewing, and more often than not, I get grounds in my coffee. It has caused me to go back to brewing a pot of coffee.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Chris
review_text: Between the office and home, this machine gets replaced every 8  months to a year because the pumps break.  Not a reliable coffee maker at all.  Work won't purchase them anymore and we are looking for a better brand that uses k-kups now for home.
review_title: Work won't purchase them anymore and we are looking for a better brand that uses k-kups now for home
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: B. Race
review_text: Bought this unit one year ago and now the screen is blank white. I have to unplug this daily and reset the time. This is my third Keurig machine and it seems like the quality of their coffee makers declines with every unit I buy. Looking at alternatives right now, because it is unlikely that Keurig's quality is getting any better.
review_title: Keurig Coffee Maker Quality Continues to Decline
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Natasha
review_text: The time that I had to wait for this machine to prime, and prime and prime again, I could have grown my own beans, sold them and used that money to buy a coffee maker that actually works.. Never will I buy one of these again!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Maggie Ramey
review_text: I use filtered water and k cups and it gets clogged after almost every cup of coffee. The first year they told me it's normal and I have to clean it after every use. Now they said that isn't true and it's out of warranty. They wouldn't do anything about it then or no. Horrible customer service.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Benjamin Hamilton
review_text: You have to unclog it after every use or it will plug up. I've tried it with lots of different K cups and even returned one of my brewers. The needle system still clogs. I never had this issue with my old model I had for years.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: The Zeker
review_text: When I first got it I liked it. Thought the temperature could have been hotter. But no other complaints. Then the clogging started. Yes I descaled but then a straightened paper clip became my most often used kitchen items. Constant clogging. Every two weeks at most, usually once a week. For the money try another brand. I know I am. Never had this trouble with older model. K=cups too expensive to be wasting on clogs!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: winnie barnett
review_text: Two weeks ago I was so excited when I received my keurig touchscreen coffee maker.... Every other single cup brew I get this. Even after doing a needle maintenance this is what a cup looks like kcup or reusable kcup. I will be returning this for a better coffee maker
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Charles M Peterman
review_text: Tastes like plastic.  No matter how many times we cleaned it, or how we cleaned it (vinegar, soaps, etc.) the coffee always tasted like plastic.  We have an old single cup Keurig, which worked great and never had a bad taste, so we just assumed that the new versions would be the same and we never did any research.  I wish I would have.  I am buying the highest rated Mixpresso k cup brewer instead.
review_title: Tastes like plastic. No matter how many times we cleaned ...
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Luke G.
review_text: Keurig - played "all-powerful" with this release by limiting what K-cup pods can be used.  Please be aware!  This machine, unless hacked, can only brew "Keurig Certified" pods.  The touch screen does offer some more features, but Keurig left a bad taste in my mouth by limiting what coffees and teas can be brewed.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: JAMSTELLAR
review_text: I ve had multiple instances where it won t brew Keurig branded K-cups because it says they are incompatible. The cups look identical to others it will brew. It has an optical sensor that reads the lid of the cup, and apparently it is quite finicky. Going to go back to the previous model so I don t have to wonder whether it will accept them.
review_title: May not brew Keurig branded cups.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Chase
review_text: Nice machine, and makes good coffee. but a lot cheaper at C***co
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Linda
review_text: This is a replacement. I've had many Keurigs. One view stated this coffeemaker was quiet. Not really. They all make some noise.
review_title: Just like all the rest, only bigger water reservoir.

review_text: Touch screen is horrible. We have to tap and tap, so many times, to wake it. It's also noisy. It smelled awful and flavored the water like plastic. Cycled it with vinegar a few times, fixed that issue. It still sucks for the other reasons. Don't buy.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

Returned, not going to bother with another 2.0 which I was also informed was being PHASED OUT.  I'll stick with my VUE, pods are being phased out but it works like a champ.  Will just get the adapters.

name: Robert Boudreau
review_text: Fatal flaw: At this point, about 6 months in, the machine requires needle maintenance after every single cup. So much for efficiency. Other than that, it is a great product, but I find myself using it as a hot water dispenser more than anything at this point.

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Appeared to work great at first, but has inherently devious DRM installed to prevent competitors from selling cups or products for it.

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Really like this Keurig. I like the many different options for brewing strength. Only downfall is sometimes the cup sizes are off and if you have a cup that has coffee grounds they can get stuck in the needle and it spews water everywhere when you go to use. Cleaning is a lot more difficult than past models.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

review_text: This machine is NOISY!  I thought the pump was briken - but a call into Keurig told me this model had a "robust" sound. Robust??? No, its just plain loud.

WHEN I tried to return it the time was exspired

I do however love the coffe on demand and not having to brew a whole pot just for one cup of coffee. I wish the i cup were a little cheaper though.

review_text: For the past 10 years, we have used Keurig machines and have been big fans. This new Keurig is the worst coffee maker ever, run away fast! We have had 2 of them so far, and both of them clog constantly and coffee grounds in every cup. Extremely disappointing for a company like Keurig!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: plknj
review_text: Got this as a replacement and jams on a regular basis and I clean it every three cups. Avoid this one.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

name: Bob Warzel
review_text: EVERY SINGLE DAY I have to clean the lens that reads the pods.  I buy my pods directly from Keurig but the coffee maker says DAILY that "Oops, you need to use the Keurig pods)".  My solution is I keep a pod top that finally reads correctly and put it over the pod I'm trying to use and that does the trick.  When you need that first cup in the morning and you get that awful message it makes you want to pitch this thing.  Stay away!

name: Frances Gililland
review_text: What was a good machine in the past, is now so over-engineered they made a true piece of junk. I find it hard to believe this passed the marketing department as well as the customer review/trials prior to releasing it to retail stores. My first week, I couldn't make coffee one morning till I cleaned the needle. Try reading instructions at 0520. I jack with the thing for 5 minutes, 2 was just trying to make my eyes focus on the micro print instructions. I finally gave up and unplugged it to reset. Every week it would have to do this and sometimes, 3 times in a morning - just turn it off/on and it resets. At times, it doesn't puncture the pod, so it stops till you reset again. It will not read some coffee pods, so buy their brand or suck it up buttercup, no soup for you! The pump makes a lot of noise and it makes you select the cup serving size every time you switch flavors.  I have 3 of these boat anchors. 2 at work and 1 at home and I can tell you, its a over priced piece of junk. I trashed the home unit and bought a superior competing brand that is very quiet and painless to use. Keurig  will not see another machine coming to my locations.  AND - What the heck is the phone jack plug in the bottom of the unit for? It must call 911 when you stroke out trying to milk this cow for some coffee. Mine is for sale. 20.00 plus shipping and you can have it. 2nd thought, Discounted - send me 20.00 and I UPS it to you. Well OK - send me your pity party story. The person with a life sorrier than this machine wins it for free.
review_title: Most expensive boat anchor on the market.
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size

Despite cleaning the needle at least the next 4 or 5 times, the brewer still would stop brewing.  Took it back for full refund.  Found out that this model has been discontinued and replaced by K-Elite, which is not as fancy but coffee is just as good; I know because I just bought the K-elite C which comes with extras stuff.  Don't waste your money on the 575....

name: Gina M. Cloe
review_text: Overall the K575 makes good coffee, so it does its intended end purpose. However, a few things I don't like about it. Maybe it's due to the various dispensing sizes, but it seems to take much longer to heat up than my previous Keurig (which only offered a couple sizes). So, when filling a coffee mug, there is a bit of a wait (too long, if you ask me) between the first filling, the unit "processing" (heating additional water), and the next filling. The other issue is that the clock began blinking one day for no apparent reason. When I was finally forced to phone Keurig's customer support, I was told that the screen can be "a little buggy" when left the coffeemaker is left fully on 24-7. So, they advised that I turn the unit off, if I'm not going to use it for a number of hours. I call this a "workaround" for a problem design. Again, once I turn it on, I must wait for it to heat up. I'd probably buy this Keurig again because these problems are not "show stoppers." But they are annoying inconvenineces.
review_title: Overall the K575 makes good coffee, so it does its intended end purpose

name: dennis k.
review_text: I have owned two of these machines.  A 1.0 and now a 2.0.  The 1.0 power on switch went bad and couldn't get a replacement and bought the 2.0 k575..  If you decide to purchase  the K575 expect, in the first couple years, to have the lid begin to get stuck and you have to reach up inside to get it down per other posts and that works.  This is caused by two flimsy flaps that have been broken off by the constant use of opening and closing the lid and the metal bar using them to raise to the next level when going in towards the back!!  You can watch the mechanism while looking up inside and watching  the metal rod and see where its sticking  I was able to fix mine by creating two replacement ramps out of a plastic lid 1/4 X 3/8" long with a  taper in the long direction and gluing it in place of the missing flaps!!!  This fixed  one of the myriad of problems I've had with the K575 but other posts fixed those problems most of the time!!!!  I have since acquired a model B70.  The opening and closing mechanism is so much easier and unbreakable.  I will use it in my motorhome and continue using the fixed K575 in my home!!!

review_text: I had been noticing that my tea tasted funny and my tummy was always a little queasy.  One day, I saw a FB post (and I usually disregard) that really hit home.  Someone else had the same issue.  I followed their advice and switched to another method for a week.  Both my tastebuds and tummy got better.  So I took mine apart like they did in the video and sure enough, the inner tank was gross and had bacteria!!!  Like the people in the video I had also cleaned my regularly!  I threw mine in the trash.

name: Jason
review_text: Ok, after reading the two year old reviews, I found myself in awe over what people were complaining about, even the guy who did a while "scientific density test" whatever that is (someone has waaaay too much time on their hands. I've owned two other brewers when I decided to upgrade. It is July of 2016 as I write this, come on people, does the fact that you have to buy a coffee they have rights to THAT big of a deal? Really? I found that there are ample coffees out there for all budgets that will work, so, where's the issue? Not what your "regular" coffee is? Guess what, welcome to life and change happens. Many said that it was Keurig's greed, why? They paid for the rights, they haven't put a gun to your head and told you to buy their brewer! You CHOSE it without I can only guess, reading the information on it. Yes, I read about the brewer PRIOR to purchase, ignorance is NEVER an excuse. I have had the brewer for a month now, no problems at all, has larger cup options, the carafe is great, and with K-mugs now, you can brew a full travel mug. Bottom line, when you buy something, READ THE DETAILS, it's not Keurig's fault that you were lazy. For people who like a good product, ease of use, and so many options, this is for you. If you're worried about spending an extra buck or two on coffee? I think you can still get a drip coffee pot for around 12 bucks at Wal Mart.
review_title: Stop whining! Read item specifications BEFORE purchase!
product_name: Keurig K575 Single Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker with 12oz Brew Size
